Reviews.Title: “Soon to be back together”
Reviews.Author: Travelteam69
Reviews.Content: First into a Bridge-to-Bridge room after renovation/refurbishment demonstrated a few problems with the room that indicated the staff just hadn't checked things well enough before letting the room. In the bath, new wallpaper was only partially adhered to the wall and sloppy grouting between tiles was messy and obvious. A floor lamp wasn't properly assembled and it leaned in a corner between windows that bracketed spectacular views. The gym was not reopened yet, but that was not indicated on the hotel website. The property location is excellent for city business, but a few blocks away from popular shopping/strolling. Staff courtesy/knowledge, room service and room amenities were excellent. Given the price is at the top, until the kinks are worked through there are better values at other of the luxury properties in the city. Suspect these problems are likely to be resolved soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I'd wait until they finish their renovation”
Reviews.Author: TUCK1995
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice 4 nights here. Location is terrific, views are unbeatable and service was generally pretty good. That said, their temporary lobby is comical and I think it really does impact their performance and the experience - e.g., very difficult to engage with concierge as everyone in their cramped confines heard everything...and there was sporadic construction noise in lobby and on floors under renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: michaelthornton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on honeymoon in 2004. Great location, nice room with great views and first class service from everyone. We were treated very well and the room service was very good. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “First rate all the way”
Reviews.Author: Jenna G
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped out of the cab until I collected my luggage to leave, this stay was top notch. They welcome you with tea and cookies as well as personalized pillowcases! The views from my room were great - I could see a the Bay Bridge and could use the binoculars they provided. In addition, I have to thank the staff. I had the unfortunate luck to be struck with a 24 hour bug and the concierge made sure I was ok. They sent someone for gatorade and room service sent me the food I requested, which was off the menu. My only complaint was that it took a while for warm water to reach the shower - I had to let it run for a good 5 minutes -- and also that the shower head faced the door so the floor got wet when the shower door was opened to step in. I know folks mentioned that the lobby was under construction, but really, the rest of the experience was so pleasant and nice that I barely noticed that. I would definitely stay here again without question!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet pretty rooms with city views”
Reviews.Author: ladyssecret
Reviews.Content: Stsyed here for business trip. Walking distance from office. Look past renovations to lobby. Temporary small table check in. Staff is professional and polished. There was mention of tea after check in which sounded good but it never arrived. Room service was simply delicious and served by nice staff. Bathroom nice sized. Bed comfortable and well lit room. Gym is small but clean. At rainy check out the front desk kindly assisted with transport. Overall a solidly good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was non-existant.”
Reviews.Author: racewalker2000
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find a polite doorman, prompt check-in, and tea as soon as we arrived. After that, we were snubbed out. There was not even coffee. I asked the desk where I could go to get coffee; rather than say "we can get that for you" I was told "down in the financial district there's a Starbucks." Long story short they were closed and I ended up walking all over the financial district to get coffee. I finally got it at ANOTHER hotel. On my way back two guys tried to rob me, their plan failed miserably as two BART police intervened. I got back 1.5 hours after leaving and spent the rest of the evening dealing with a sprained ankle. The doorman must have left because I never saw them again. I was SO p*ssed that our romantic vacation was screwed that I wrote a letter to the management. The reply... NOTHING!!! I paid a premium for an anniversary hotel and was treated like crap. I have nothing for these people!

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel -- it's expensive but well worth it. The whole hotel really has a fantastic elegance about it but at the same time it's not stuffy. Very comfortable, great accommodations, fantastic staff, and a very convenient location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: friscotexas41
Reviews.Content: Top-notch service from an exceptionally friendly and well-trained staff make for a perfect experience. Rooms are spacious with obviously phenominal views. I can't believe this hotel is not five-diamond becasue it far exceeds most five-diamond hotels out there. I can't wait to visit again after the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “My #1 hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: IceQueen2013
Reviews.Content: Concierge arranged all our activities and even got us tickets to a sold out showing @ de Young Museum. Good security measures from staff. I came in once after a run but forgot our room number. I was all sweaty at the front desk asking them to check the room # of my card key. They were courteous while at the same time exercised caution to protect guests. Zero stuffiness even though this hotel is in the heart of San Francisco's Financial district. We were always dressed in simple clothes but always received 5 star treatment. Service industries definitely can learn from Mandarin Oriental's customer service strategies. It is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Even with renovations going on, it is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: This is one of a handful of exceptional view hotels in San Francisco. Taking up something like the 38-48th floors of a financial district skyscraper, there is water and city out every window. Right now the lobby is a shambles... a couple of people with small desks trying to keep up appearances as you walk through a temporary hallway. It will be a new and lovely lobby in four months. Right now, not so much. But no reason to complain because they are so nice and the rooms are so exquisite. Complimentary Chinese tea and cookies arrive soon after you do. The rooms are tasteful and comfortable with plush robes, DVD players, marble baths with sep. showers, etc. The furnishings are of high quality. I disagree with the visitor who described them as tacky, but each to his own tastes...Room service is expensive but very good. Virtually not a peep from another room so the soundproofing is great. The location is wonderful... two minutes to the Ferry Building, two to BART/MUNI, ten minute walk to Union Square, etc. It is expensive, no denying that. But if a luxury room is your splurge or standard, this is a great place to stay. Silk Road food is great and the service is wonderful. Daily assortment of papers, turn down, all the amenities and some charming extras too.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money. slow service”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business last year .. mostly because I think the mandarin in HK is one of the best hotels in the world, but I was disappointed by the hotel in SF. First they couldn't find the booking, they didn't try hard to resolve it despite my obviously tiredness following a direct flight from London. I ordered room service and it was slow, the food was look warm and there wasn't much of it.

Reviews.Title: “ok for about half the price - not comfortable or elegant”
Reviews.Author: MDG02186
Reviews.Content: This is a strange hotel - the room rates are very expensive, which is fine if you're getting something. The decor is kind of tacky, it might be old. The lobby was undergoing renovations and management didn't set up heaters in the alternate lobby- somehow it was colder inside than outside. The hotel was freezing throughout. Our room was tiny - the reservation said queen bed but it was full size. The view was fantastic, there's probably nothing else in the city like that. The fitness center is very nice-there's no need to go to the Equinox across the street. Concierge staff was very nice and helpful; sent us to a very good restaurant. For breakfast, try Le Boulange around the corner- much cheaper than the hotel food and it was excellent. It did take forever to check in - the front desk setup isn't very efficient. Parking is $50/night.

Reviews.Title: “high quality intimate 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ___Dr__J0Hn___
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed for 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental San Francisco. This was a very satisfying experience and one that I would recommend. We were upgraded to an executive corner room which the size of a small suite. The room decor and views in two directions over the bay were exquisite. The bed was heavenly! While this is a 5 star hotel, I was particularly impressed by the friendliness of the staff who couldn't seem to do enough for us. For example, the concierge recommended an Italian restaurant for us, booked it, and then offered the hotel car to take us there free of charge. We also dined at the in house restaurant Silks which was most enjoyable. We did notice that the hot water temperature is somewhat delayed, taking some minutes to reach the desired level. We questioned the duty manager about this who was most apologetic and sent a complementary bottle of wine to our room for our inconvenience. We were impressed by the thoughtfulness, kindness and professionalism of the staff who were truly outstanding. If you want a 5 star experience without the coldness, formality and anonymity of the usual 5 star hotel stay, then this is the choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slairson
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Unparalleled service. Ridiculous city views. Concierge desk phenomenal - we were able to have excellent restaurant and transportation experiences on NYE weekend. Despite all of the above, the hotel is a bit dated. They are undergoing a facelift early 2012 and I will be one of the first to check in when it's done!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonerSW2
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise the hotel highly enough, my partner and I stayed over new year and had such an excellent time. It's so rare these days to find a hotel which combines fantasitc unobtrusive service with lovely rooms, great views and a convenient location. We both travel extensively for business (and pleasure!) and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city. Thanks to all the team there for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a View to Match”
Reviews.Author: neilos100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the MOSF for three nights in September as part of our honeymoon and it was, needless to say, fantastic! Our room was on the 42nd floor with views over Alcatraz and Pier 39 on one side and the Bay Bridge and Coit Tower on the other side. The room was huge with an equally large bathroom, sitting in the bath watching the San Francisco Fog rolling in over Alcatraz was superb! Massive bed, big screen TV and views that were breathtaking. Took a little time to accustomise to being so high up, especially walking across the skybridge when you come out of the lifts! The maid service was very efficient, with turn-down done every night. The housekeeping in general, throughout the hotel was first-class. We didnt use the restaurant but we did use the bar and were very impressed with the great service from all the staff who served us. A special mention must go to Priscilla though; exactly what a good bar manager should be like, she was very friendly, knew her stuff and we thought she was outstanding. (The Nolet Gin cocktail she made us delicious.) Thank you! Overall a very well run establishment with service of the highest quality and a great location. San Francisco is the kind of city that you can easily walk around to see most of the sights with great public transport...the cable cars were brilliant fun! Neil and Veronika

Reviews.Title: “GREAT view from your hotel room”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeNosy
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviewers wrote about the great views from their hotel room. Stayed here recently and the view from the rooms where you can see the Bay Bridge is really beautiful. This hotel is conveniently located. It is easy to walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the Ferry Building. If you do get served by Daniel Johnson, Asst Front Office Manager, then you are in luck. I have stayed in many different hotels in different countries. His guest service is really one of the best that I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Better everytime.”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at the MO for New Years 2010 and just after New Years 2011. When I stayed for the first time on New Years 10' I was absolutely ruined as there is no way I can stay at a normal hotel because of the excellent service. The moment I pulled up to the front of the hotel the door man walked out and opened my dates door and had the valet take the car as well as the bellhop take our luggage. I stayed in the Bay Bridge Mandarin room which was exceptional! Now the stay after New Years 2011 I booked the cheapest room they had for 2 nights under the California resident rate and just joking around I asked for an upgrade on their Facebook Fan Page. When I walked up to the counter the lady took my name and immediately said 'Welcome Back' and informed me that they were able to upgrade me to the Dynasty Suite for the 2 nights. Listen folks, the fact is I am a truck driver and I wouldn't be able to afford 2 nights on a weekend in a Suite at the Mandarin if I tried saving for a year.. Bottom line is even though I don't make much spending the extra money for this place seems well worth it based on the superb service and just the the kindness of the management. I live 40 minutes away.. If I will spend the money and stay here over any hotel in San Francisco I would hope that you people traveling larger distances would seriously consider it! I can't wait for another excuse to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good not special”
Reviews.Author: Maxsar911
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice on business in the last 6 months. The views are great. They left binoculars in both rooms. Room service had good food, and the exercise room is fine. It isn't as easy to find as some of the other high end hotels I have stayed at in SF, but it wasn't hard to find with GPS. Overall there is nothing wrong with it, but also nothing that grabbed my attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic world class restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Alex F
Reviews.Content: Staying in San Francisco for a few weeks earlier this year allowed us to try some of the great restaurants around town. Our best experience was by far a special evening put on by the Mandarin Oriental restaurant! Travelling a lot we are wary of hotel restaurants however this one was an exception. The event was a booking only event with the focus on sustainable use of all ingredients used for both the wine and all dishes. Suppliers and producers were engaged during the evening to discuss “what they did and why” with a variety of wines coming out to match the dishes. The value for money also stood out for us, in Australia we pay $150 per person for these events, here the cost was half that. The evening was a big success and we suggest any travellers to San Francisco keep the eyes open for one of these events and quickly book a table as we did with friends who were in town around the same time. Hotel great, restaurant FANTASTIC

Reviews.Title: “All-Around Luxury”
Reviews.Author: robotmuppet
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, plain and simple. The staff is just amazing, and the rooms and views are stunning. We can't think of a better place to stay while in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “They had me at hello!”
Reviews.Author: f00lme0nce
Reviews.Content: My first experience at the Mandarin was years ago, when my husband and I walked into the lobby and we were greeted by name and immediately I was asked, "Would you like a cup of tea?" They had me at hello! Years later we returned and were greeted the same way. But this time when my cup of tea was delivered to my room, a birthday cake was too. Our room was spacious and had a beautiful view. The bath was stocked with amenities. The only fault I could find was the lack of plug-ins for all our electronics. The hotel will be going through a comprehensive renovation so I am certain that will be addressed. The Mandarin used to be a "business hotel' but now is a great location for everything, especially a morning walk to the Ferry Building!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterplus
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing view of the transam building from our room. Rooms were small and food left room for improvement. Good base for a weekend visit to San Fran

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: PetieNYC
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 11pm from NYC. The bellman took our bags to the desk and dropped them off (including golf clubs) he didnt ask if we need further assistance. Nor did the receiptionist ask when we grabbed all of our bags and clubs. We were too tired to complain. We then went to the room and ordered room service. We had the chicken satay..it was the worse meal. The chicken looked liked it had been reheated numerous times. Sadly this Hotel has seen better days. It is very dated. I feel you can find a much better Hotel for the same price. Stay away from the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed me in 25 years.”
Reviews.Author: TOWestonCT
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Mandarin since it opened and it has always been a great hotel - small, super quiet, and very high end rooms and views. Most of the rooms, if not all, have been recently redone, and the appointments are excellent. The Hotel is right in the center if the business district, but close walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Embarcadero. There is an excellent restaurant, Silks, in the hotel, and the lobby has a nice sitting area and sushi bar service in the evening. For a business traveler this is one of the best hotels in town, and I have stayed at most of them and prefer the Mandarin to every other hotel I have tried. Having stayed here repeatedly, I can say that I have never had an issue or a disappointment. The rooms are located on the top floors of a skyscraper and offer some of the best views in town. Ask for a view of the Transamerica building and towards Coit Tower for the most impressive views.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: jaharts
Reviews.Content: The location for the Mandarin in San Francisco is perfect for business travelers. The hotel is at the top of a tower and the views are incredible. The rooms were satisfactory but a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin room is amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night. Check-in was easy, was told I'd been upgraded to city deluxe room. My first room was very small, very very high, and narrow. It felt way too high and the windows made a weird banging noise. I thought, hmmm. This is not going to work for me. I need to switch hotels. So shortly after a bellhop came up with some complimentary tea and i told him that the room was making a weird noise. He heard it and offered to call the front desk to switch rooms. Lo and behold I ended up in this incredible room called the Mandarin room with panoramic views, a huge bathroom, and a completely different vibe. So it ended up being a great stay! It was great of them to switch me to such a fantastic room. Service was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Leisure Travel is great but Business Traveller, read on”
Reviews.Author: Rick_TO
Reviews.Content: I'm here as I type this. Like any hotel with an Asian heritage, service is outstanding. Truly. And the views, as others have said, are amazing. The big place where the hotel falls down and is no better than, in my opinion a Holiday Inn or Motel 6, is outlets. If you are a business person and you want to sit at the desk, no outlets. You will crawl under the desk to see one outlet only with the other one taken up by the lamp. This makes a material difference if you are using a MIFI device, charging your phone, and banging away at the laptop. It's really bad. There is a 4 plug (you get 3) on the left side of the bed behind the night stand which you have to move to get to them. If you are the lay in bed with the laptop person, phone on night stand, okay, you'll be okay. The hotel could easily solve this with a power strip in the room up on the desk. Internet is expensive just because they can. So, I nail em with average because the plug situation is poor for a business, high end hotel but also because when I called for a power bar, nobody could get me one. Weird given the high end nature of the hotel. Leisure Travel? Excellent location, great service, great views. Rick

Reviews.Title: “Poor check in experience, otherwise a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glostamember
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the wonderful Mandarin Oriental in Singapore we had high expectations for the one in San Francisco, in fact it was the reason we chose to stay there. However we do not feel that it matches up to the Singapore one at all. The room was undeniably blessed with spectacular views of the Bay, and it was well equipped, but somehow it felt a bit “tired” We felt the major problem was that the reception and restaurant are some 36 floors below the accommodation, so it feels quite detached. Its location however is fabulous and the rooms were quiet and very comfortable. We did have an issue at check in. We were checked into the wrong room!!. We noticed personal welcome letters to another guest and even a monogrammed pillow. We reported this to the Front Desk who simply wanted to ship us out the room as quick as possible in a very unceremonious fashion. No porter was made available to move our luggage and the promised complimentary coffee never appeared. We had to call twice to get it delivered. Not a very good impression on our first arrival and certainly not the level of service we experienced in their Singapore hotel. It was also evident that we did not qualify for welcome notes! After this episode everything went smoothly. The other staff were fantastic, courteous and caring. After a bad start they redeemed the Mandarin Oriental in our opinion

Reviews.Title: “Top View”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: The property is about to undergo an overhaul later this year; nonetheless, the property is in outstanding shape and boasts outstanding views (from the rooms) of the city. The service, comfort and atmosphere is among the best. After staying here, I question why I have stayed at the Four Seasons on Market (which is a top end property without the views).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, disappointing service options”
Reviews.Author: AmidaBuddha
Reviews.Content: Being a big fan of the Mandarin Oriental group, this review is a bit hard for me to write. This is the fourth MO property that we stayed at, and the first that left us disappointed. We stayed at the MO SF for four nights last summer. The hotel is different to other MO's in that the lobby and reception are at street level. It is somehow very small and unimpressive. You can literally walk past the hotel and not even notice it. The rooms are located at the top of the twin towers and offer great views of the city and SF Bay. Our room had a bit of an awkward shape, being long and crooked. The bathroom was rather small, and the water pressure was weak. The room service was excellent but very pricey. All in all I believe there are better hotels in SF if you are coming to visit the city for a few days. Given the fact the the SF MO does not even have a SPA facility, there is not really a big reason to stay at the MO. I would recommend staying the Fairmont (see my review) or the Four Seasons instead.

Reviews.Title: “At best, average”
Reviews.Author: luxurytravelguru
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the St Regis but it was sold out, and for good reason and so opted for the MO. There are significant differences in rates between the two properties and the MO comes in a few hunderd dollars cheaper per night and so this is not a side by side comparison but more so a brand comparison having stayed at most of the MO properties worldwide. Lets forget the view, there isnt a bad view in San Francisco. The hotel is jaded-dated and really feels that it should have had a makeover in the last 10 years. Check in was standard. I had a corner room on the 38th floor and was not impressed by the dated decor and furnishings. I ordered room service for two and for pre-prepared food it took a long time to arrive, and with a very limited late night menu, no french fries etc. The grilled cheese sandwich was foccacia with feta spread, disgusting and inedible and my chicken sandwich a close second. A call to complain to the front desk was met with "thats how the chef choses to prepare the dishes'. What chef??? Clearly there is none in the building overnight and frankly in a hotel of this reported caliber I expect a lot more and a better response from the front desk. The bed was ok, the thread count and pillow number a far cry from other MO's and the bathroom towels getting on the thin and grey side. In fact, nothing exuded a sense of luxury. The next morning the elevator was out of service and I was stuck on the 38th floor until after a number of calls to the operator (handled poorly) it began operating again. Asking the doorman for the nearest drugstore resulted in me being sent on a 6 block hike, although I subsequently find one just around the next corner. The front desk did not know where there was a good late night deli or restaurant and thats how things just continued to go. A burger and fries in the lounge bar area took an age to arrive mid-afternoon and just ok, and for which they comped us a couple of drinks. Frankly this property needs a lot of work in every area if you want to compete with the St Regis, Four Seasons etc The guests seemed to comprise of many retirees and Asians and perhaps may appeal to those demographics but for these 30-40 something discerning guests I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the MO in San Fran, especially the views”
Reviews.Author: HammerNJ
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed over 2 weekend nights on our way back from the Wine Country before a business meeting the following week. The service, views and food were impeccable. High Tea in the Lobby Lounge is a must. My only complaint is a lack of a Coffee Maker in the room. For $500 a night (Breakfast included), there should be one. Otherwise, the views on both sides are incredible and the Staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “hotel above the clouds”
Reviews.Author: rasheed_albader
Reviews.Content: this is my third stay in this hotel,i dont imagine staying in san francisco in anyother hotel. if you like the luxury and high quality service, then this is the place. i just love it

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Nutria2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night, and all expectations were fulfilled. I paid $325 for the night, which, for a top flight San Francisco hotel, is about par. Excellent service and accommodations all the way around. Polite and efficient staff, quick check-in and -out, cordial and friendly bell and door staff. The rooms were excellent, unlike a previous poster, I had no issues with the shower or the TV, and there was a large soaking tub. Perhaps some floors had been renovated (I was on the 40th floor). I did have to chuckle, however, at one reviewer who was grousing about TV reception. Granted, for $900 a night, you should get a lot of TV channels and a clear picture, but come on, you're in San Francisco, on the 40th floor of a hotel with a view spanning the Golden Gate Bridge to the Bay Bridge, with a world of adventure awaiting within walking distance right outside the hotel's door. And you're watchin' TV? The usual amenities were present: robes, slippers, comfy bed, high-quality iPod dock. The location is great, within a few blocks of the BART, which I used to ride from the Oakland airport. Cable cars are nearby, along with great hole-in-the-wall restaurants (Try Tad's Steaks and the Tadich Grill for such cuisine). I'd highly recommend the hotel. Hope you fellow travelers enjoyed your summer!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: We booked the "Perfect Pair Combination" promotion and got one Madarin Room plus one Bay Bridge View Room, joined by a small private foyer for $875. It then looks as a standard 2-room suite. All has been written about the views from the 42nd floor. The genuine views when you get there are beyond the words. Nothing short of spectacular. I could have stayed all day, but for the fog which showed up quickly. Perfect check-in, in that lobby about which lots have been written. OK the ceiling is a bit low, they could use a western flare to lighting, but anyone describing it as spooky probably never drove off the fontiers of Beverly Hills before. Get real, guys !!! A few desk attendants spoke to us immediately in immaculate french. Bellman came up in a matter of minutes. I was really put off when reading reviews about outdated or faded rooms, but am glad we gave the MO SF a chance. Rooms were in perfect conditions. Pristine and perfect. Now this is clearly an asian company, using an asian style which was probably more fashionable in California 15 years ago than it is know. But it is beautiful, and pristine. Where the age is showing, is in bathrooms. Tiles do look outdated, as do the faucets and electric switches. But this is a hotel, not a Prada showroom. We are seasonned travellers, and picky and demanding, but we were not shocked neither at this, not at the price requested for this. Outstanding beds, and I do mean this. We used room service for breakfast, to take advantage of the room and the views as much as we could. In the morning, the view was blacked by the fog, but a delicious breaksfast, if not cheap (but why should iy be cheap there ?) more than made up for it. Were there glitches ? Not to speak of. But : $50 valet on a saturday night ... Really ... 4 people can stay in a Motel6 for that kind of money !!! Add the tips, and ... ? The tea service that was proposed at check-in, and accepted, never made it to the room. Elevators take a decade to come. Not even sure they were both working. And it IS dark, where you wait for them.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 fabulous days at the Mandarin Oriental San Francisco...from the valet to ck in/out to the room service...everyone was wonderful...we were treated like a welcomed guest. The rooms are fantastic, beautiful views and ammenities The Hotel is a "MUST EXPERIENCE"

Reviews.Title: “View and service were amazing... rooms were not...”
Reviews.Author: SapaGiono
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. When I found myself going to San Fransisco for a weekend (for a girl's weekend) , I decided to splurge and reserve the Dynasty Suite. This was part of the Suite Arrivals package, so transportation was included from the airport to the hotel. Nice way to start the trip. When we pulled up at the hotel, we were greeted (by name) at the car by one of the staff. Check in was super quick. A lot of people have complained about the lobby being dark and dreary, but I thought it was very nice. The hotel rooms occupy the top floors of an office building in the financial district. The view is AMAZING. Unparalleled. I looked at some of the other 5 start hotels in SF, and while they were nice, the view at this property beats all of them. There were a lot of nice touches in the room-- a smal fruit platter, fresh flowers, personalized stationary... but the view-- WOW. The windows open a little so you can get fresh air. We could see alcatraz and the bridges from our room. Really nice.... which brings me to the room. I hate to say this, but the room itself was dissapointing. The furniture was old and outdated. There were 2 TVs in the suite, and they were both fuzzy in reception. There was not much of a channel selection. There are also 2 bathrooms in the suite, which was nice. The showers were really old with some unattractive tiles (reminded me a little bit of a locker room shower). The bathtubs were also small. The bed was super comfortable, though-- and great quality bedding. I used the gym one evening, and it was great. A huge variety of updated machines with a TV on each machine, water bottles and towels were also available. While the view and service were unparalleled, the room furnishings were too dated. At $900/night, it was dissapointing. I recommend it for the view and if you have extra cash to spend, do it. I will definitely try and stay at another Mandarin Oriental property, but sadly, don't think I will return to the SF location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emf465
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed two nights at the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco. We were booked on the 41st floor in the "bridge to bridge" room. WOW! What a gorgeous view! The room was fabulous. The staff very courteous and professional. It was my boyfriend's birthday. They had a beautiful birthday cake delivered to our room upon arrival. We were also impressed with the workout room. All the equipment is up-to-date. The room is very clean. They provide chilled bottled water, towels, TVs, earphones, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ruined The Experience at $800nt!”
Reviews.Author: jd1menke
Reviews.Content: I made personal call to arrange a very luxe, special treat for my son and fiance. Booked the Bridge to Bridge Room ( when the Manadarin Room was unavailable ) and made very specific requests: 1. The room MUST, Must be one with the bathtub AT the picture window overlooking the view. 2. The champagne must be IN room upon arrival 3. My son must NOT have to have to deal with or even SEE any of the costs ( room alone was $850+ wx tax and champagne. They confirmed and guaranteed all would go as planned. They insisted I fax a signed doc guaranteeing the credit card I just verbally gave them with all info, address, etc. They would fax that to my home immediately that very evening, the day before the booking date. Easy Breezy They NEVER sent me a fax! My son arrived and had to get them to email me the doc which turned out to want: Copy/photo, front and back of credit card Copy/photo of my driver's license All the same information they already had re: address, phone numbers, etc. and, oh yeah, that signature. I had to stop a business mtg to go do all this. I work in same city as hotel and live ten miles away yet they spelled Piedmont as Tiedmont and that caused problems. I got a call an hour later from the manager. I thought he called to apologize since by now my son saw all the costs. but, oh no. Silly me. He called to tell me he was doing me a great "favor". My fax was "sort of dark" but he would accept it anyway. What? Is this a five star hotel or Motel 6 in Amarillo? Who asks for all that "proof"? They usually contact the credit card, yes? The customer service is the poorest I have ever encountered, and I stay at five+ star hotels all over the world. Their arrogance knows no bounds. And the lack of the bathtub by the window - the whole reason for choosing this hotel - was pure BAIT and Switch. Guess paying almost $900/nt buys you very little respect or service at this hotel. Never Again! I did not ask to be "comped in the future, ask for any favors to make up for their errors - wine for sin and guest. I just wrote them what they did wrong, got NO reply and now prefer to SPREAD the WORD.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: BennieKatz
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco was amazing! The staff was warm and helpful. Our room was fantastic. We were on the top floor (48th) in a corner with the most amazing views of the city. The room was large and comfortable and the windows even crack open so you can get fresh air. The decor is a little dated but with views like that who cares! It was very clean and comfortable. There was even a large window next to the soaking tub so you could lay back and take in the city. Everything about the stay was perfect, tea upon arrival, excellent room service, helpful concierge, great in room massage and fantastic food. The only disappointing thing was that we had to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located around the business district and is pretty convenient for Union Square. I enjoyed the experience and was fortunate to get a nice room which overlooked the bay - could see Alcatraz and the Bay Bridge. Even if you don't get a direct view from your room there are great views available in the communal areas of the high floors where you can take your pics. The room itself had great products and fresh fruit - quite typical of the MO worldwide. Service as ever was high end. I tried afternoon tea at the hotel which was worth the experience - give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect of a mandarin oriental, but the view....”
Reviews.Author: SwissEmgem
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental stands for an excellent name, but besides the absolutely stunning view of San Fran, I would not recommend this hotel. Ok, maybe we had bad luck with the room. It was a very small and over-priced corner room. The bathroom was always freezing cold and the bathwater didn't run properly. The decor was oriental shabby and the in-room dining was extremely overpriced for what you got. The bed was pretty good and combined with the excellent view, that gives a notch more on the rating. Oh yes, and the lobby was non-existent.... all corners and spooky dark. Be sure to find that lift!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: mchyde
Reviews.Content: Ther room is great, the views are spectacular, the service is exceptional and the food at Silks was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views, swanky - best for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: 1984travel
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay. It would have been excellent but the hotel is looking a tad tired. Probably in need of a small facelift. Check-in was efficient and the staff in general was excellent. We had a bridge to bridge room on the 42nd floor which afforded us the most INCREDIBLE panoramic views of the city. Room was spacious and well-appointed. The Molton Brown toiletries provided were a nice touch, as was the bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate strawberries (it was our anniversary) on arrival. The hotel was mostly frequented by business guests - probably the most suitable hotel for business travellers as I noticed it has a good conference centre and office facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAli
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service. Obviously well-trained staff. Good restaurant, but can be a bit too quiet and dull. Hotel rooms are well appointed but some can be pretty small. Location is great, right in financial district, with many great restaurants nearby within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “4th Anniversary - Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: Spade05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in April of 2009 (why am I just now reviewing?) for our 4th wedding anniversary. We chose the Mandarin Oriental among others because we enjoy secluded luxury when my wife and I travel, and that is exactly what you get at this hotel. Here are some thoughts on the property.. Location: The Mandarin Oriental is located in the middle of downtown San Francisco, within walking distance to every major attraction, though if you have been to San Fran, you know that walking is not preferred with all of the hills. The hotel is actually part of a larger office tower, and just occupies the top floors. The tower is right across from the TransAmerica building. The only downside to the location is that it is not right in the middle of the hotel / tourist district, so taxis are not necessarily prevelant, though the staff does a nice job of calling them in advance. Accomodations: We booked a bay view room, but were upgraded to the "Bridge to Bridge" room, which is a corner room that overlooks both the Golden Gate and Bay bridges, TransAmerica tower, Alcatraz and Coit Tower. We have stayed in a lot of neat places, but it will be hard to beat that view. Since you are on about the 50th (?) floor, the views are unbelievable, and we just kept our windows open all the time. The room is spacious and well designed, but not that large. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom had both a tub and shower, which was nice. Did I mention the view? Property: As I mentioned, the hotel is on the top floors of an office tower, so it is a little interesting. The lobby to the hotel is a separate entrance and is somewhat quaint. They have a restaurant there, but we did not eat at it. The hotel is very quiet and you can tell most people staying there are successful businessmen or well-traveled couples. Not really a party crowd, if thats what you are looking for.. perfect for us. The lobby provides an unlimited selection of DVDs that you can watch for free in your room. We also ordered room service one night, and breakfast one morning and the food was very, very good. All of the staff are very professional and knowledgeable about getting around the city - even provided us with a complimentary umbrella to use. Overall, we do not regret any upcharge we might have paid to stay at this hotel. My wife and I still talk about the wonderful view and hope to come back to that wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Mandarin San Francisco ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: BayouCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a well managed property with an amazing staff. This was our second stay at the Mandarin and it was even more remarkable and gracious than the first. With multiple trips to San Francisco, and many 5 star properties to choose from, the overall genuine graciousness of the staff from the bellmen, front desk, town car drivers, concierge to housekeeping will keep us returning. The hotel is exceptionally well kept and the views are worth any expense that may deter you from staying here. Pre-timed room service was prompt and morning coffee served without cream was so quickly handled that I did not have the chance to sit back down before the doorbell rang. Amazing, since we were on the 40th floor. The bathroom in the Golden Gate Mandarin is worth the stay itself. For business, you are in middle of the Financial District, walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown, and the trolley, BART and MUNI transportation systems are all within a couple of blocks. If available, their house town car will provide transportation to downtown events. The Concierge desk was more than helpful and knew the city well. This was our first Golden Gate Mandarin Room, and I thought the Bridge to Bridge room and view were spectatular. Stay once and you will be hooked. I'm a Fan!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service & gorgeous views of the golden gate & city!”
Reviews.Author: DayungBidayuh
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge for our last nights stay in San Francisco. And indeed, the 41st floor has breathless views of the Golden Gate & City. Location wise, it was right in the financial district. Was not really the perfect area considering we had 2 young children with us and thus, had to walk a good 15-20 minutes to restaurants and closest sight seeing spots. But we did like the quietness of the street in the evening. And it wasn't that bad really. We definitely had a good work out from all the walking we did. Anyway, back to the hotel - you can't go wrong if you want views and services. But it has to be 40th floor and above or else it will be just teh view of the city or other buildings. Another drawback as well is it does not have a pool. So had to do other fun stuff with the kids on our down time. But then again, I suspect it caters more for business people who do not have time to linger by the pool:)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Rachy2008
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful, views are spectacular, cocktails are great. Just a ten min walk to union square and go to the port building for great eateries. Lovely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mikewm4300
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in an Exexcutive King for $500 per night booked online. The lobby is very small and a very small elevator. We were shown to our room and then a tea service arrived at which they called my by someone else's name. I don't really care but some people might. We were given a view of the downtown on the 39th floor which did have a spectacular view. The bed was very comfortable. The concierge was also very helpful and knowlegeable. The room was very clean, including the windows. we didn't have any outside noise problems with room 3902. For negatives, the bathroom was very plain with a normal tub which was unusual as the bathroom was so large. For an extra $500, they could have installed a 2 person jacuzzi but went cheap on this. The bedside table looked like it came from a garage sale...cheap veneer and chipped and well worn. They wanted an extra $15 a day for wifi when Motel 6 gives it away for free. It seems absurd that a guest pays $500 a night and you want an extra $15 for internet which costs them pennies a day. After having toured the city and seen some other hotels and their online prices, I think there is much better value elsewhere. I think the Westin, Intercontinental and so on would be better value but maybe not the view.

Reviews.Title: “WOW FOR THE VIEW”
Reviews.Author: Niffykat
Reviews.Content: Got here saturday.... still here, but I just had to write now (hopefully I won't jinx us).. we are staying in one of the two bed corner rooms.... and OMG the views are just fantastic. The other thing that has been exceptional so far is the customer services, every thing I would expect. and a special call out to DEAN the Concierge (sp?) he is fabulous. Oh, yeah and even though this is in the Financial district there is convenient transportation to everything and A LOT within walking distance..... more at the end....

Reviews.Title: “A Great Luxury Hotel in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: travelhive
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most accommodating luxury hotels in San Francisco, but it comes at a price. The lobby is somewhat underwhelming, but when you get your room, you will be impressed with the view. Rooms are from the 38th through 48th floors, and the rooms are in twin towers that are connected by a glass-walled walkway. Great location for business trips, located in the Financial District, but easily within walking distance of the Embarcadero, the Ferry Building and Union Square. Rooms are large by San Francisco standards and very quiet with little or no street noise and no noise from adjacent rooms that I could detect. Not many freebies - no free wi-fi, but they do supply free bottled water, and on arrival a pot of jasmine tea and almond cookies. The staff are incredibly accommodating, but unobtrusive. The bathroom in my single room was was fair-sized but not large, but the shower was excellent. Very clean and well-appointed room.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Newport_Chameleon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Golden Gate room on the last night of a special trip to northern CA. The view was outstanding. Prior to our stay I was a little concerned due to other reviewers saying that the rooms were dated and a bit worn, but I didn't find that to be an issue at all. Granted, the Asian theme is prevalent, but the room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and the Molton Brown products were a plus. My only wish was that the tub was Jacuzzi - ah well. The room was quiet - not much city noise on the 48th floor. We ordered room service for both breakfast and dinner and were pleased with the quality of the food. One note - if you drive your own car to the hotel, there is limited space to pull over for the bellman, and if he is not out in front the hotel is easy to miss. We were glad to see him on our second pass by the hotel, and we were greeted warmly. We had a very positive experience with each staff member we encountered, and I give them highest marks for service. I wish we could have had a few more nights to stay and enjoy that view! I would love to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cam0608
Reviews.Content: Fantastic attentive service. We were upgraded and given champagne as it was our honeymoon. The restaurant, Silks, was fantastic. The views over San Fran were fabulous. A really special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the view”
Reviews.Author: Lovevacation77
Reviews.Content: Service was great , the view is amazing. worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel with Friendly and Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheBayou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a Sunday and Monday night in May 2011. I was here for work and spent the majority of my time in meetings at the MO Cafe lounge. The staff were great and very attentive to any requests. The rooms were nice, but nothing great. In my opinion they were not as nice as the St. Regis in San Fran. The rooms were of course very clean and the cleaning products were high quality. The neighborhood is business focused, not tourist or scenic. If you are in town for a deal/closing, you can walk to the offices of many of the large national law firms. I ate breakfast in the cafe upstairs (I don't recall the name) but it was nice, quiet and the menu had enough to please everyone in my party. I would stay here again, but it would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Luxury Hotel with amazing views!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMcGowen
Reviews.Content: So, after many trips to San Fran, I finally found the perfect luxury hotel! Great views --- on the 48th floor!!!! The staff was friendly and so wonderful and helpful! I had planned on leaving for dinner, but decided to stay and eat at Silks. Great dinner!! Great breakfast, too. The room was gorgeous, the bathroom huge, and I will be back! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and Not Chic”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Saint Regis in San Francisco, but it was not available and I chose the Mandarin, a great disappointment, although I am growing increasingly frustrated with the chain, which is painfully inconsistent. In the case of San Francisco, the room, including the bathroom, was pure late 1980s, both in style, functionality and shabbiness (my first sight upon entering the room, even before the views which are great, was a badly stained red silk banquette.) The food was good, the bar sad. Not close to being worth the price. Anything short of shutting it down for a complete renovation will do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MW4Florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 54 th floor. The view was like nothing I've ever seen. We had very high expectations for this stay and it was everything we thought it would be. Thank you MO.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, personal service”
Reviews.Author: Andy Hayler
Reviews.Content: I had a three day stay here in June 2011, and was genuinely impressed. We stayed in room 4511, which has dazzling views over the bay. Apart from the lovely room, I was particularly taken with the service. The doorman greeted me by name even on the first day, which something I can only ever recall happening to me once before. When you phone the concierge you get through instantly, and they were extremely helpful. Perhaps this is not the centre of the tourist locations, but I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...can't say enough good things”
Reviews.Author: koko1109
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the hotel we were greeted by friendly and very helpful staff. The room was beautiful with wonderful views. Room was extremely clean and very comfortable, we didn't want to leave the room to go site seeing we were so happy there. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and wiling to go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major attractions. We will definitely stay here again the next time we're in town. Great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DonManolo
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent place. However... At these rates, I expect wifi standard and at no cost anywhere in the property. The Concierge (Calvin) was amazing. But when he was not there, one of the other concierge gave me directions for a restaurant, different from where they had made my reservation. Totally in the opposite direction.... Whoops! Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In San francisco”
Reviews.Author: mfcMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the Mandarin and I must say it was perfect in every respect. From check in to check out the staff was attentive and professional. Our room had windows on 2 sides granting us a spectacular view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay Bridge. We arrived after dinner so we ordered room service. It arrived in record time and was cooked perfectly. The bed was very comfortable with the best linens we have experienced. The bathroom amenities were top notch as well. Highly recommend this hotel above all others in the Bay area!

Reviews.Title: “First class business hotel”
Reviews.Author: HecG
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent business hotel, and was quiet on the weekend we stayed. The staff learns your name quickly and uses it so that you feel at home -- they say "welcome back, Mr Jones" when you return. They are polite and helpful and go the extra mile to provide special service (emergency dry cleaning in my case) when you ask. The room we had was an executive corner room, and both the bedroom and the bathroom were large and comfortable. As others point out, the hotel rooms are on the 38th to 48th floors of an office building, and so the views are really superb. The bed is very comfortable. The amenities are what you would expect -- decent size flat screen HD TV, large desk, couch, chair, coffee table, etc. I could nto receive wireless Internet. There is a fast wired connection but you have to pay about $15 to $12 a day for it -- this struck me as nickel and diming. The room is serviced twice a day so you have fresh towels whenever you like. We did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel -- there are superb restaurants just around the corner that we wished to try (Michael Mina, for instance). Breakfast was good -- very good coffee & juice, and a good variey of food. I was glad there was no buffet, so our meal was made to order. The lounge at the reception is a good place to meet friends and have a drink and snack. It has free wireless Internet. Don't underestimate the location. SF is a wonderful place to walk, for instance along Market St, along Columbus, and along the Embarcadero. It is really good to be at the BOTTOM of Nob Hill as it is so much easier to walk the city from there and to get back. Taxis can be very scarce in SF and the line for the cable car can be long for those staying at the Ritz! We were happy it wasn't a hike up the hill to get home. It is also close to lots of really good restaurants and a short walk to the convention centre, but far enough away to be much quieter than, for instance, the Mariott Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Business Hotel with spectacular views and service - could use some room updates”
Reviews.Author: snayyar
Reviews.Content: Located in the FiDi and right by public transportation, you are close to it all. If you are here on business you will find yourself a short walk away from most major firms in SF. If you are here on leisure - a 10 minute walk to the Ferry Building or Chinatown. The staff is at the top of their game. Can't say enough good things about them. They are eager to help and do so with a smile. The maid showed the same pride in her work as did the front desk staff. From the smallest request (dental floss) to recommending transportation - the staff were helpful and plentiful. Most rooms will have excellent views - the hotel is situated on the top floors. The views span both bridges and you can see Alcatraz and even Angel island on a clear day. Make sure you get a Bay View. The room itself is luxuriously apoointed, but cramped (hey, it's FiDi!) and could use some updating. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and likely should be replaced. However, the room was clean and the bathroom was large with a tub and shower. The Room Service was prompt and what I've come to expect at a MO. The menu is diverse with a few Asian influenced dishes. The food was just slightly above average. There is a small gym, and also passes available for a small fee to the nearby Equinox gym. No pool on site - but Equinox has one! The views are really what sold me on this place. I woke up every morning knowing I was in SF with the Bay and Golden Gate bridges outside my window. I sipped cocktails to the sun setting behind the bay each night. The hotel has a luxurious ambiance and proved to be an excellent choice for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well located downtown SanFran”
Reviews.Author: GVendryes
Reviews.Content: An hotel meeting all standards you would expect when in business trip in San Francisco. Its layout with this glassed-window corridor at all floors gives an impressive view of the city. Rooms are spacious, with giant windows to enjoy full view of the city here again. The only negative comment would regard the very tiny bar in the lobby, but being so close to all entertainment places in the city makes it forgivable.

Reviews.Title: “Service is nice, but rooms are a little out of touch”
Reviews.Author: JeremyZNYC
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental San Francisco clearly means well, but the very helpful staff can't make up for rooms that are in pretty dire need of a reboot. Checking in is fine, the doorman is usually there and helpful, but sometimes not. Front desk is efficient and friendly. The rooms are weird, though. Views are great, rooms are large, and the television is nice and big (although strangely placed), but the decor is pretty tired and a little worn. Honestly, I expected more. It's furnished like some sort of Asian theme hotel from the mid-90s. It's still very pleasant, but just odd. Bathrooms are huge and very well appointed, although also a little outdated. Wifi was great, but our experience was that the valet was very slow. I'd definitely stay there again, but I wouldn't get excited about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYSmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three different times in January 2011 and in October and November 2010 for business trips lasting several days. The hotel is perfectly located in the downtown/financial district/Embarcadero area, so was very convenient for meetings there. The staff is very polite and accommodating. Great room service. The hotel bar on the ground floor is nice and understated - perhaps a bit too understated if you are looking for some place to impress a client. But still very nice. On my second trip, i got a room right next to the elevator shaft on one of the lower floors of the hotel. it was fine, but the room was oddly configured and now and then some elevator noise. Try to avoid those. The other rooms I stayed in were terrific, and some of them have truly spectatular views of the bay and bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location - Fantastic View!”
Reviews.Author: TheScarlett
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Mandarin properties on other vacations (Hyde Park and DC) and had heard that this was THE place to stay in San Fran so we had high expectations. We were not disappointed and would absolutely return to this location. The only real letdown we had was that our room was in another wing from our teenagers when we had indicated that we wanted adjoining rooms - we had to cross a sky bridge (with an amazing view of the iconic Transamerica Pyramid) to get to them. Our room had amazing panoramic views of the Bay and was romantic and spacious. The room our teens shared was also spectacular and roomy enough to comfortably give all three the space they needed to spread out. We were easily able to set out on self-guided walking tours from this perfect location. Yes, Mandarin properties are expensive but if you want to treat yourself do not hesitate to consider them worthy of the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Value in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Pabs_HK
Reviews.Content: Although the Fairmont and the Intercon Mark Hopkins are grander in stature, in facade and in their lobby lounges....I enjoyed the Mandarin Oriental because of it's cozy rooms and elegant views of the skyline. Next time I am back, I'd choose between this or the Mark Hopkins; and never staying at the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “The best view of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Porsche0606
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It’s very modern place. I prefer to stay there when I am in San Francisco, because it is in downtown and it's very easy to get anywhere from there. The rooms are excellent! I always stay in upper floors. I would recommend order champagne during the sunset time and stay in your room overlooking Golden Bridge. Also, there is a great marble bathroom with big shower and huge tub next to glass wall. The view is PERFECT! The only thing that I don’t like, they don’t have spa or even pool in hotel, which is very unusual for Mandarin Oriental. But I still would recommend this hotel for anybody.

Reviews.Title: “most comfortable bed I have ever slept on!”
Reviews.Author: loverofred
Reviews.Content: Amazing views, fabulous service, awesome shower, great location...but the bed....oh so comfy...made it hard to get up in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay For Business Trips”
Reviews.Author: mattjb24
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for part business part pleasure. The hotel staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. The rooms were well done and even though on the smaller side the angles of the room made them feel roomier. I had an amazing water / city view. But then again, I think every room has an amazing view because the hotel rooms start so high up. No pool or health club in the hotel which I typically enjoy. Its a great business hotel but not a great place if you just want to veg out in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but had an unpleasant check-out experience last time”
Reviews.Author: cacktusjack
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at the Mandarin Oriental San Francisco. Our first one was in 2008. We love the Mandarin Oriental chain and already enjoyed the Oriental Bangkok and the Dhara Dhevi Chiang Mai. At the MO SF the bridge-to-bridge-room is our favorite with a really spectacular view from the Golden Gate to the Bay Bridge. The room is spacious, clean and beautifully decorated in Asian style. The unexpected downside this time was our check-out. Because of our 9pm flight back home to MUC we asked for late check-out via email months before and also at check-in. We were told it shouldn’t be a problem due to low occupancy and we could check-out at least at 3pm. We should call again on our departure day because maybe we could even stay a little longer. On our departure day I called at 11am and they told us that we have to check-out at 12pm! They didn’t know about the late check-out at 3pm anymore and said the hotel is fully booked. Her tone was still polite but a little harsh. After being shocked and discussing in vain what to do now I asked for the manager on duty and after a little while they finally offered us to switch to another (lower category) room to stay for a few hours. Even though we are really thankful for that courtesy, this day was full of stress and discussions and we didn’t feel a warm welcoming treatment by the front desk any more. We wrote a detailed letter on their comment-card but unfortunately received no feedback within the past 4 months. We never had those issues at other 5* hotels around the globe. Friendliness, warm & welcoming atmosphere and a personal level of service are our most important criteria in choosing luxury-hotels. Well, the MO SF is a beautiful hotel with a spectacular view but due to the departure day experiences of our last stay we’ll likely choose the Four Seasons or the Fairmont instead.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I've had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Joanne94005
Reviews.Content: From the gracious, friendly service to the well thought-out guest rooms, it was a delightful stay. The staff always wore a smile no matter what time it was (blame it on the jet-lag) and their attention to detail was unrivaled. Food in Silks was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Tried and True”
Reviews.Author: Travelite
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable, the room, though showing it's age, was extremely well-designed and had every amenity for the business traveler. It was also very quiet and had a gorgeous view of the Transamerica building. The lobby is no frills, so if you're looking for a more lively bar/ seating area, this is not the place. The location was great, especially since I'm a member of the Equinox in NY and close to all my downtown meetings. It was half a block from the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services, clean, wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilson
Reviews.Content: I am very picky @ cleanliness and the friendliness of staff. MOSF wins gold stars on both fronts. They have the best concierge staff I have ever encountered. Though I agree with the review that the lobby is getting a tad tired, it is still very nice and the fabulous staff more than makes up for that. They offer a car service to local restaurants - the service is free. They also can arrange for a private driver/tour gude of the city which I found very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views and Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: RoamingMenehune
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter, the staff of the Mandarin Hotel are incredibly welcoming and willing to help make your stay as pleasant as possible. The view from the rooms is absolutely breathtaking. Although on the older side from a decor perspective, the rooms are well-kept, clean and amply sized, as is the bathroom. I also am a big fan of the Molton Brown products and the towels which I found to be softer and fluffier than the Four Seasons. The financial district location is great if you're in town for business meetings, but probably a hassle if you're looking to do more tourist-centric activities.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with great views”
Reviews.Author: screwtape
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a city view room, for a trip that was a combination of work and holiday. Having seen the view from the hallway in the upper floors, we realised it would have been worth paying the difference in rate for the better view of the bay and bridges. The location is handy to the financial district and the ferry terminal/Embarcadero, but is very quiet over the weekend. The room was well laid out, with a large bathroom taking up nearly half the space, and the rest split evenly between the king sized bed area and a sitting area. The décor was slightly dated, with quite an Asian gold feel, but it was clean and in good condition. The window could be opened to let in fresh air, which was pleasant. The concierge was very helpful, providing driving directions to Muir Woods, a great breakfast café recommendation (Dipsea Café) on the way, and bottles of water to take with us. The room service menu was quite good, and delivered promptly when it was promised.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again without question...”
Reviews.Author: Bedstuygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel only occupies the top 11 floors of the bldg. The good news is the bldg is almost 50 floors high! Beautiful views. Great service. I could not believe the view from my room. Depending on what side you are on you can see the Golden Gate bridge, Alcatraz, and the water. Be sure to ask for that side of the floor. Still amazing views of the city on the other side. It's like NY on sterioids. David - the bartender who works the evening service is AMAZING and very funny and personalble. I had an $18 burger for lunch, but was not disappointed in the least. I will dream about it for years to come... great job Manarin. Top notch all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: MO is an international chain, and we have been to several of their locations, but this hotel has the wonderful feel of a boutique hotel. Every employee was friendly and helpful. Our room was comfy and quiet (this is a big deal for me---I like to sleep). Shower water pressure was great, and the views---wow! We had breakfast and lunch at the hotel---expensive but very good. Only faults were the person who checked us in did not have the correct paper we requested delivered in the morning (we did get it at the front desk), and there was only one sink in the bathroom. These are minor details. I loved this hotel and I am picky about EVERYTHING. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccible Service”
Reviews.Author: Meanwhile
Reviews.Content: An outstanding group of individuals work at this hotel, from the maids, to the doormen to the waitstaff. I rate their service a 5. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The hotel is extremely quiet. The only reason I did not give it a 5 was because the room was slightly (very slightly) tired.

Reviews.Title: “Not the newest and shiniest, but a true San Francisco gem.”
Reviews.Author: SuperCarnitas
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times as weekend getaway from the kids. Look for the state resident weekend promotion, which nicely includes the valet parking. Is it the newest hotel in SF? No. While the room furnishings have been very nicely updated, with very comfortable new beds, there's certainly no hiding that the building dates back to the late 1980s. Is it a "be-seen" venue? Nope. The lobby and the public spaces have a decidedly residential feel, and the relatively small room count adds to that. But this place absolutely wins over them all with the warm, genuinely friendly, unchanging staff (they recognized us after the second visit); understated, comfortable elegance; and the unbeatable views, on which much praise has already been heaped. As an area resident, it was a real treat to enjoy a portrait of San Francisco -- the changing lights, rolling fog and all -- from this perspective. It gave me a renewed appreciation for the beautiful city that it is. On the subject of views, I too would recommend the Bridge-to-Bridge view rooms. Previously we had also stayed in the Golden Gate Mandarin rooms, and didn't find it such a great idea for a couple of reasons: (1) One of the windows facing the Golden Gate is located in the bathroom, over the tub. Which would otherwise make for a nice brochure shot, but really, how much time can you spend in the bathtub? (2) There is also a permanently-lowered sheer shade on that bathroom window, presumably to spare the view of your buttocks from the area office windows. And a nice bonus: The windows open ever so slightly for ventilation. The fresh air is nice up there. Walk on over to the Ferry Bldg Farmer's Market on Sunday morning, nosh on some tasty eats, and get some produce loaded up into the car for the drive home!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the view, necessarily the room”
Reviews.Author: emkay09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night, first time in SFO. We stayed on the 44th floor and needless to say the view was fantastic. The rooms were old - clean but dated. However be aware that this hotel is out of the way if you want to be a tourist and check out the wharf like we did. We made the mistake of strolling around and then trying to catch a cab in that area of town, basically there weren't any. We had to walk all the way back and wait for a cab to come to the hotel (it's not like NYC where they are all over the place that's for sure). I did have a strange occurrence though. The hotel town car gave me a ride back from the wharf one night and I dropped my wallet in the car. The car came right back after dropping off another couple from the hotel to a club and the wallet was gone. I told security that the wallet was in the car and if he found the couple (who were obviously staying at the hotel), most likely he would find my wallet since the driver said he didn't see it. Sure enough, security got it for me the next morning - minus all my cash. My stupid move for leaving the wallet, however you always wonder what actually went down with the cash. The reality is, it's a city and I was thankful to get the wallet back with all the cards unused and in place.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: DAKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at MO hotels in NYC, Bangkok, and Munich we had high expectations particularly regarding the levels of service from the normally excellent staff. Unfortunately we were very disappointed. At check in there was some confusion about the booking with one of two rooms booking being lost. The receptionist was slightly flustered and eventually blamed our agent (Amex platinum service) for the error. Luckily we had a printout of the confimation and she eventually found the "lost" booking on the computer. In addition the scheme that we had booked offered an upgrade if available - I had to specifically ask for this and at first she denied we were eligible for this but then in view of the delays and lost booking one room was upgraded to a higher floor. During the whole process the receptionist made me feel that the fault was mine! Then she forgot to swipe my credit card and I received a phone call at 9:30pm requesting that either I come down or that the card be collected from the room and swiped. I told the receptionist that it was inconvenient at this time and I would bring the card down the following morning - she reluctantly agreed to this. The next morning I took my card down and complained to the duty manager. As a result of my complaint, our breakfast plan was uprgraded (from continental to full) for our stay and a small bottle of port was placed in our room. All in all the discussions were very hostile with none of the charm that I expected from MO staff. In addition our teenage daughter was placed 6 floors away from us despite a specific request to have the rooms close together. The rooms were excellent with magnificent views though the decor slightly tired, the bathrooms were nice and the bed comfortable. Breakfast was a major disappointment, if you are in need of quick service this is not the place for you- it took up to half an hour to get a bowl of cereal and although the staff were running around and polite the delivery seemed to be very inefficient with items missing from orders, and delays requesting milk and coffee. The overall impression was one of chaos with poor staff leadership. The lobby and bar area was the opposite of welcoming; gloomy and cold and seriously in need of a make over. The concierge service was the only aspect of the hotel that lived up to MO standards. I do wonder if there are some serious managerial issues as we overheard numerous other guests complaining both at breakfast and at reception about the service. In fact a friend of ours waiting for us in the lobby commented about the number of guests complaining. In addition the staff seemed preoccupied with internal processes and not focused on the paying guests. For the money there are better places in SF.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidnightTraveller79
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable holiday at the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco. The bedrooms were large and the view from the hotel was amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: reymic
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with my stay at Mandarin Oriental. The room had a lot of space, the bathroom was huge. We parked our car in the hotel for three days/two nights and it cost us $150, but we knew what we were getting into. We loved the location of the hotel, we went to the Ferry Building every morning for breakfast and Blue Bottle Coffee. We walked to Chinatown, North Beach, the Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf (pier 39), etc. The best part of the hotel were the views. Each floor has a landing area with floor to ceiling windows that were just spectacular at night. The hotel seemed a tiny bit run down in certain areas, and it wasn't the nicest hotel i've ever stayed in...If I wasn't paying, I would love to stay here again. It was just very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay & Views to rave about”
Reviews.Author: JHNY
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, San Francisco for my 1 year wedding anniversary. We both were pampered the minute we checked in. The doorman was very memorable, front desk was very friendly and efficient in check-in us in. We booked a Mandarin King Bay Bridge room category. The views from the room were amazing. The hotel was very thoughtful in adding binoculars as an in-room amenity. There was a nice large working desk, a love seat, another small couch, a comfortable bed that eased away all stress, plushy slippers and towels. The décor was colored in red & golden yellow. . very luxury and similar to the colors of sunset. What impressed me the most was the enormous marble bathroom and the view. I could have lived in there! The amenities given were Molton Brown, which smells wonderful and soothing. Although the hotel has been there for a while, their technology was up to date. Nice flat screen TV and ipod station! It was convenient because I just purchased an Iphone too. We stopped by the Sushi station at MO Bar for a quick bite. The food was fresh and service was quick. I was pretty surprised at how busy it was. Afterwards, we went out for dinner and the concierge assisted us on arranging the house car service. We ate at Silks’s Restaurant for breakfast and there were so many choices, I wasn’t sure where to start. Our server was very polite, very cheerful and had a lot of patience with us. Even at one point, the manager stopped by to see how everything was going. We had such a wonderful time that we look forward to coming back! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, leisure or business because the overall experience can’t be beaten. To me, when the staff cares about every guest, and not because it’s their “job”, that is when you’ll know it’s genuine. And I see that in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly bed with beautiful views and outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: mwagnerwoodshop
