Reviews.Content: The bridge to bridge room is worth it! The view is amazing! The service was outstanding. We have stayed at many 4/5 star hotels and this was right up there. Only drawback is the food - pricey and limited selection and not outstanding for prices but there are a lot of delicious dining options within walking distance. Beds were heavenly and shower had power. Would most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - terrible service”
Reviews.Author: demetgolf
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best views in San Francisco. I would highly recommend the Bridge to Bridge rooms. However, the staff were not friendly, not helpful, and not appreciative of our business. You would be better off at the Four Seasons or the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Canadian5022
Reviews.Content: We booked a bridge to bridge room which gave us panoramic amazing views from the 42nd floor. Expensive but it was for an anniversary and worth it. The hotel staff could not be more helpful, from booking tours before we got there, giving advice and responding to any request immediately Beds are deliciously comfortable. The hotel is in the financial district, walking distance to all main areas. Tip 1..carry a jacket!! It can get cold , can be hot in am and then temp drops with the fog Tip 2..if you just want to ride a cable car pick the California St line and don't wait for hours in the Hyde Powell lines Only go to Fishermen's Wharf for 30 mins (too touristy) Top 10...Alcatraz, walk around Mission and Castro district, murals on Balmy Alley, Supersightseeing City Tour (covers main spots), see the sea lions at Pier 39, walk DOWN the Filbert St steps from Coit Tower, Chinatown Eat at Soma's (Fisherman's Wharf.)....Swan Oyster Depot, Polk St (take California St cable car up to top terminus)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatWV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the MO for 2 days on our way to meet a cruise in Japan. We selected the hotel for its reputation for luxury and quiet. We were not disappointed. Our room was quiet, well-appointed, and comfortable. We used the hotel web site to book a discounted rate. We ate breakfast in the hotel and service was excellent and the food, while expensive, was very good. The hotel is in the financial district so there is no shopping or week-end action. Those who want to be in the center of action should consider their location for a week-end stay. We preferred the quiet so it wasn't an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Room Small, Bathroom Huge”
Reviews.Author: augtraveller82
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was small, but everything else was great. The bathroom especially was awesome - it was so large, in fact, that I kind of think they should have devoted some of its square footage to the smallish room. Service was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in SFO.”
Reviews.Author: heeto
Reviews.Content: We had a Bridge-to-Bridge view and it was worth every penny or should we say worth many $100 dollar bills!!! The hotel is not cheap but the views,rooms and service make up for it. Our room had three huge windows so lots of light and was decent size.We could see most of Sf and bay from our bed.Amazing.Did not want to loeave our room. Very clean and quiet room.Only about ten per floor and not many children around.We were in room 4211.Looked like the rooms were recently refurbished and the bathrooms had Molten Brown products. Room service wes efficient and tres polite.Check in was prompt and we checked in around 12 noon. We liked the location.It took 10-15 minutes to walk to the Embarcadero or 15 minutes to Union Square with all its shopping and dining options. Yes the immediate area may get quiet on the weeekends but you are not that far from nightlife.There are a couple of new and decent restarants nearby such as Perbacco. We enjoyed our meal at Boulevard and Chaya Brasserie.Vegetarian restaurant along waterfront-The Plant?-was excellent for lunch and sitting out looking into the bay. A couple of negatives: 1.Bathtowels need to be updated.They were a bit worn/ratty and thin. 2.Soap a bit too small 3.Shower head needs updating with a rainshower perhaps? 4.Mold starting on ceiling of shower 5.Lobby underwhelming a bit dark and low ceilings. 6.Bar too quiet ,dark and uninviting for "cocktail hour".Ok for morning or afternoon coffee/tea but did not make you want to sit and have a martini prior to going out for dinner.At times it was understaffed.One night the poor server had to serve five table AND make the cocktails. Having said all this we would DEF stay here again and absolutly recommend it. I only mention some of the negative points because its a LUXURY hotel with luxury prices so the bar needs to be higher than most other hotels.Its a great hotel but it can be even better.Somehow the non Asian MOs seem to miss something.This one is one of the best MO outside Asia for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not for long pleasure trip”
Reviews.Author: tobywonder
Reviews.Content: Net net: Great no-hassle, comfortable, quiet hotel. Hotel lacks character and location to be something more (e.g. honey moon spot, extended leisure vacation). As of now I would return to this hotel in the future, but not for a pleasure trip. Check in: 2 minutes -- they are FAST, especially if you check-in late at night. Not overly hassled with bus boys/valets. Room service: Breakfast was nice. Late night dining room service is a disater (prepared sandwiches, microwaved pizza) Location: Financial district, so not much nightlife going on. Within walking distance to bars etc., but not in the thick of things and you will be cabbing it mostly. Room decor: Nice, ornate rooms with great views of the bay (depends which room you get of course). Doesn't feel very fresh, but its still cozy. However, being so high up means you will hear howling wind. I like that personally.. adds to experience of the views/being so high up. Room privacy is high and I never bumped into another hotel guest on the floors, albeit did bump into them often in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views From Every Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Lap0LuX
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I like to act like a tourist in my own town. My man and my four legged furry friend booked a suite for an all out weekend in San Francisco. The city by the bay. I work in the financial district in S.F. and I walk by this hotel daily. The staff always seems so happy and pleasant. So, it seemed like a great place to stay. The coolest thing about this hotel is that the rooms start on the 40th floor. You can imagine the spectacular views you get that high up. Our suite had a view of The Golden Gate Bridge, Coit Tower, Angel Island and The Bay Bridge. AMAZING! I'm all about amenities and service. Let me tell you, The Mandarin Oriental has it all. I was so delighted to find out they offer a complimentary shoe shine. All you have to do is drop your shoes in a basket outside the door and they polish them up just like new. We ordered ALL of our meals in room. They offer roomservice 24hours a day. Can you say Dim Sum at 4a.m.!!!! Awww yesss! The tea service was devine, I highly suggest "High Tea" Although, I must say, I adored the turn down service thee most. I wont spoil it for anyone who has not stayed there as of yet. But, when you do stay, and they come knocking in the early evening, let them in to work their magic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel1234london
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was allocated a fantastic room on the 43rd floor with the most amazing views over the bay. The room was huge with the most comfortable bed that you just sink into for a great nights sleep. Warm welcome from the reception desk and always welcomed back after a day sightseeing. Definitely recommend the Mandarin Oriental and will hopefully be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels503
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a rainy winter weekend with an invitation-only AMEX FHR 2:1 offer. Very worthwhile. Breakfast and afternoon tea were included. Lovely weekend. Friendly staff. Lots of extras. Rooms: We had a Bay Bridge view on a very foggy day, would have preferred Gold Gate view. Spacious room. Nice bathroom. Loved the Molton Brown shampoos! Took breakfast vouchers as credit toward room service. Paid a few just bucks extra for full American and Asian breakfast. They were awesome, especially the Asian breakfast with dim sum. For afternoon tea service, the sandwiches are custom made for you. We also took advantage of borrowing iPhone chargers and nice umbrellas from front desk. Free shoeshines too! Friendly concierge. Hotel room was clean. They give you customized stationary which is cool. Turn down service is very nice. Internet and parking are expensive. You can park 10 ft. away from the hotel for free on a Sunday. No pool or hot tub, but they have some alliance with a nearby athletic club. On-site fitness center was nice too. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable with awesome views”
Reviews.Author: cats77
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my boyfriend while he attended a conference for part of the time. the staff was very friendly and helpful. the hotel itself was very clean. the bed was probably one of the most comfortable i've ever stayed in. location wasn't bad... but i think i'd prefer to stay somewhere near the wharf. that's just a personal preference. the view from our room was amazing. had clear views of both the bridge and alcatraz. room service was so so. we ordered it twice and both times were just okay. but it came fairly quick and with plenty of fries on the side.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome best service - however it is expensive”
Reviews.Author: Victor_the_sailor
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk and nice hotel. "Bridge to Bridge" view room has amazing views. Parking was $50. plus $7. tax

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular - don't hesitate to book this property”
Reviews.Author: lebonvivant
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental San Francisco is one of the rare hotels which under-promises and over-performs. A stay there in one of the Golden Gate Mandarin signature rooms is a worthwhile treat. We enjoyed tea of our choice and cookies in the room as a welcome and noted that the views were even better than promised, especially in the enormous bathroom. While it is true that there is no Grand Hotel sense of event at this property because the lobby is small, the adjacent bar and lounge dark and awkwardly configured, there is no pool (though the Equinox club is just around the corner with guest privileges), etc., the staff service and the views more than make up for these lacks. The on-site restaurant, Silks, had an excellent tasting menu in the New American style. The concierge was extremely helpful making reservations, room service was prompt, exacting, polite, and accurate, maid service was excellent, and we appreciated the little touches, like the first initial of our family name tastefully-embroidered on one of the snow-white, silky cotton bed pillows, the offer, each early evening, of a special treat such as a Bento box of nuts or dried fruits presented with orchid blooms, a small bottle of Port, a basket of fruit, etc. We will certainly return to this property as we were extremely well-taken care of and could not get enough of the views. How rightly, can one respond to the reviewer below who complained of San Francisco fog?

Reviews.Title: “A room without a view”
Reviews.Author: Jamesthefirst
Reviews.Content: Wwe stayed in the Mandarin riental as part of my honeymoon trip. I got a room on the 45th floor with panoramic view of both bridges. We could see one bridge very well but the Golden Gate bridge is 99 times out of a 100 covered in mist. The room was very well appointed but for the money I payed it should have been. The bar restaurant was the only one open in the hotel for our stay although I understand that they do have another. This bar restauirant just serves basic food which is very nice but it closes about 9.30pm I really struggled with Sanfrancisco with the various areas and where best to stay. If I was doing it again my location would not bother me and I would just get a cab to where I wanted to go. If you have lots of money to spend this hotel will not disappoint you. We dined at Tommy Toys chinese restaurant one night which was very nice. The hotel layed on their limo for us which was very good of them.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: OutInTheStreet
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Mandarin for 4 days in August of 2009, and do not have a bad thing to say about the property. It is in a great location, the staff is very helpful and courteous, the business center was great, and the spectacular views from the room were out of this world. Our room was some 50 stories above downtown San Fran, and although the price is high for a room here, words do not describe the views that you get from the room. It is really something to be seen, and everyone should be able to stay here at least once in their life. We walked and took the train and buses everywhere from this location, and did a lot of sightseeing, including taking in a Giants game, and going to a rock concert. If you are going to stay 5 star in SF, this is the place to do it!

Reviews.Title: “Views, Views and Views”
Reviews.Author: tennis_ace_2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer and then again for NYE. Been to all the nice hotels except for St Regis in SF and can't recomend this hotel enough. Rooms are comparable to the other 5 star hotels in city. Amenities probably not as nice as Ritz (Indoor Pool) and FS (great workout facility), but service is comparable along with the good Dining. Car service is handy for short trips and room service and other hotel services also on par with other like hotels (exception is Ritz Clubrooms which are above and beyond). But what got us to come back here instead of check out the St Regis (same price) is the views. NYE fireworks and in general views day and night are spectacular! I thought I would get tired of the views, but second time was as good as first time!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Kara42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before Christmas and cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Our room was spacious and elegant, but what stole the show was the view! We were on the 44th floor and watching the sun set on San Francisco was magical. We opted to stay in and enjoy the room service since we had been flying all day, and the food was out of this world great. I also have to comment on the level of service. It is second to none. I have never been treated so well. They look after your every single need. To say that I loved this hotel would be an understatement. I'm moving the Germany in a few days and will stay at the Mandarin Oriental in Munich. I can't wait to see if it's as wonderful, but I'm sure it is!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times: best in the City”
Reviews.Author: scfphoto
Reviews.Content: Have stayed countless times in San Francisco over 20 years: Huntington (nice pool), Four Seasons (pretty rooms), Ritz Carlton, and many boutique hotels; many of them repeatedly. The Mandarin Oriental is my top pick - the view is amazing, the location is perfect, the staff are delightful, the rooms are comfortable. Maybe not the most plush room of anywhere, but very comfortable, nice decor, quiet, and very nice linens on a very comfortable bed. The bathroom is functional and pleasant. The view and the location are THE BEST. You won't be disappointed. We have stayed many times and look forward to returning in a few months...

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the View”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel located in the Financial district of SFO for four nights. Hotel is part of a mixed use building so ground floor space and lobby elegance is not particularily notable. Postiives are the employees who are very freindly, fantasic concierge and door staff . parking is downtown prices at $57.00 per day. Room service - was also good with good selection and presentation if you do not feel like going out. Rooms are spacious and typically equipped for a 5 star hotel with fantastic views ,and while our room was not facing the Golden Gate we still had a great view from above the 40th floor ! Only weakness was housekeeping with linen changes not frequent which was surprising for a hotel of this standard If you can afford it a nice hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Still a fan but not so much !”
Reviews.Author: Akrut
Reviews.Content: I am a MO fan and have stayed at many of their properties. As a matter of fact they are my favorite hotel brand. This was my first stay at the MO San Francisco and probably my last. Here is my opinion on this hotel. Pros: Excellent service just like you would expect from MO Incredible views, I doubt any other hotel can beat their view and this is the same in many of their properties. Cons. Location: great location for business but not so much for a weekend getaway. Lobby and bar: I think that this is the main reason why I would not stay here again. All of the MO that I have stayed in have a spectacular lobby and an even more spectacular bar, usually with an incredible view (Tokyo, NY) and always with a great ambience, I like a hotel with a great bar so that my wife can take her time getting ready while I have a cocktail or two. The lobby of this hotel could be the lobby of any 4-5 star chain hotel, nothing special, but the lobby bar which is right next to the front desk is the dullest bar I have been to in years, it has absolutely nothing special, no view, no ambience no nothing ! Rooms: Although the view was incredible, our room (a bridge to bridge room) was nicely decorated but very small and very plain, again what you would expect from a "hotel chain" like Marriot or Westin but definitely not from MO. We picked this room for the view and it was great but it would have been incredible if it had floor to ceiling windows and electric curtains, the windows were small and you have to manually operate the curtains (2 per window times 3 windows). The TV in the room has no pay per view or movie channels which now a days is hard to believe but worst of all was the bathroom, small, dated, old tiles on the shower wall, I could have been at the Omni down the street ! All in all you could say "you get what you pay for" because this is I believe MO's least expensive property but if you like to stay at their hotels you are not looking for a bargain, I believe you are wiling to pay for an overall experience that at least for me was not delivered at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Not a five star!”
Reviews.Author: CAjetset
Reviews.Content: If you are used to five star service and hotels-this is not the place for you. We are travelers and travel frequently. My husband is in the industry. Rooms are not renovated, bathrooms are old and dirty. The showers are tile and filthy. Bathtub caulking is all mildew. We had a corner room and it was very disappointing (with holes in the drapes). The service was awful as well. No redeeming qualities at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of Mandarin Oriental properties around the world. The SF property definitely maintains the highest quality standards of the others we have stayed in. The service was oustanding. The staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. The view from our room on the 45th floor was spectacular and the room itself elegant. The in bathroom amenities were great. I have no negative comments about this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of THE places to stay in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: IandNizz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and part of a 3 centre trip to the West Coast. The MO provided us with one of the most memorable introductions to the city, we arrived by BART from the airport and emerged into the downtown area during a busy Friday lunchtime and it appeared like most cities.On arriving at hotel and being taken up to our room on the 41st floor we got our first amazing view of a the city from the glass walkway near the lifts. This continued in our room a Bridge to Bridge room giving us a 180 degree view of the bay and the city. We never closed our curtains whilst there so we didn't miss a minute of the view. We were also greeted by champagne and strawberries arranged by a friend as this was our 'honeymoon' after our civil partnership and also chocolates from the manager, all in the room on arrival shortly followed by the tea and almond biscuits. The hotel provided us with an excellent base to explore the city, even if the area around the hotel was very quiet over the weekend, but thanks to advise by the hotel we discovered the farmers market at the ferry building on the Saturday one of many highlights of our trip. As MO fans we were not disappointed and our stay strengthened our preference for the MO brand.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views and Service From Small Room”
Reviews.Author: westvillagelady
Reviews.Content: The views from this hotel were amazing. We stopped many times just to look and enjoy them. The afternopon tea brought to the room was a welcome touch. However, the room was quite small for two people, but the bathroom was nice. If it had been mroe than one night, it would have felt cramped. I'd also recommend this more as a business hotel, because on a weekend, this area was dead, and many cafes and coffee shops in the area are only open midweek. Don't miss the farmer's market at the Ferry Building a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JHancockMemphisTN
Reviews.Content: Absolute perfection, even without a typically imposing lobby and bar area. The rooms, staff and view are as close to perfect as is possible. The 48th floor view, the sky bridge and the concierge's assistance made this the best hotel of our trip. A+.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - as always”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: I would stay in a Mandarin Oriental in any city - as always top class staff that were very welcoming - check-in a little slow as i had arrived early but they found me a room within 10 minutes - not much of a view, but very nice room - great size, bright and airy - big bed, lots of room for luggage, desk for laptop, big bathroom - shower a little disappointing though, more of a mist than stream of water! - Concierge was very good - helped me with tickets to a game in San Diego - got us a table in Harris' steakhouse at last minute - even got the hotel car to drop us off - a nice touch, but nothing less than you would expect from this hotel group

Reviews.Title: “Faultless for a special treat!”
Reviews.Author: VandA2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in a bay-to-bay room. We did not want to leave! We could not fault the hotel in any respect. The courtesy of the staff and the cleaniness of the room were all of the highest standard. The only slight downside was the 20 minute walk to downtown. Room service and extras are expensive, but you don't have to take them, and you are probably here for a special treat, after all!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Asian aesthetic, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Flew up to San Francisco for a quick 2 night stay with 2 simple objectives: 1) to see the Georgia O'Keeffe/Ansel Adams and Richard Avedon exhibits at the SFMOMA, and 2) to sample the many culinary offerings at the Ferry Building. Both the museum and Ferry Building are near Market St., as are several BART subway stops (we would be car-less, taking BART from the airport, SFO, into the city). In the past, we have had memorable stays at the St. Regis, Ritz Carlton, Palace, and Campton Place. All except the Ritz are close to Market St., all except Campton Place have indoor pools. Online, I discovered an enticing California resident weekend rate for the Mandarin Oriental. We have stayed at Mandarins in Hong Kong and New York and think it is a luxurious collection of properties with an elegant Asian aesthetic, so we decided to book here. Of course, we had heard about the Mandarin's vaunted views. The Mandarin is located in the Financial District, 2 blocks north of Market St. This is a very quiet area on weekends--even McDonald's and Starbucks are closed--but more active areas like Union Square and the aforementioned Ferry Building and Market/SOMA are within easy walking distances. The hotel occupies the top 11 floors (38-48) of the 3rd tallest building in San Francisco, so yes, the views are fantastic. The lobby, restaurant, lounge, meeting rooms, well-equipped business center and small fitness center are on the floors 1-4. There is no pool or spa, but guests have access to these at a fitness club across the street. The floors housing the guest rooms are dumbbell-shaped with about 7 rooms at each octagonal end separated by a "skybridge" corridor with windows overlooking the bay and city. The 38th floor has 2 suites with large terraces replacing the skybridge. Our reservation was for a city view king, but I noticed online the price point of a bay view queen, with the same square footage, was often identical, so we requested and were given this room type. I thought it well worth it to sacrifice a larger bed for a better view. The bay view extended from the Golden Gate Bridge to Alcatraz, the Transamerica building, Coit Tower, almost to the Bay Bridge. An insulated wicker basket with jasmine tea and almond cookies is delivered shortly after you arrive in your room. The room was beautiful, far from a simple box shape with few 90 degree angles. The sheer shades on the window are elegantly embroidered. The MO channel on the flat screen TV is fun to watch, quite imaginative. There were 2 clocks--one a standard gold alarm clock, the other a fancier clock/CD player whose alarm I couldn't figure out. There is a DVD player and large closet. We had to request slippers. The bathroom was fairly large with 2 types of marble, although the counter space around the single sink was not ample. There was a wall clock whose loud ticking could be heard in the bedroom. The separate stall shower also was large but its tiles reminded me of a locker room. The toiletries and towels were a bit disappointing--the towels neither large nor plush, the toiletries small (1 fluid ounce each). The bath soap was the same tiny size as the soap for the sink. Overall, this was a great short visit to a great city. The SFMOMA exhibits were worthwhile, and although we missed the Farmer's Market at the Ferry Building, we were able to gorge ourselves at Taylor's Automatic Refresher, Mijita, the Slanted Door, and Hog Island Oyster Co., plus Sear's Fine Foods by Union Square. We wanted to try the renowned Dottie's True Blue Cafe in the Tenderloin, but the line was too long. The Mandarin is yet another worthy luxury hotel to consider when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Nakina
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in a king bayview room . The third night free promotion made it a little more affordable. Everything about the hotel was first class but the view of the bay from my 38th floor room was sensational. I don't know why they don't put that view on their website as it is not possible to resist it. The only drawback to this hotel is its location in the financial district. On weekends it is pretty quiet in the area ( not necessarily a bad thing) but unless you are a committed walker you are a bit removed from some of the more popular spots. It is about a 15 minute walk to the cable car turntable at Powell and Market, a 25 minute walk to the ballpark. It is actually only a 20-25 minute walk up Sansome to Fisherman's Wharf and no hill climbing on that route which was nice.We did all this walking without any problem but it takes a little more time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, views don't come much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: minijo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final leg of our honeymoon and it was a great way to end an amazing three weeks around Hawaii. After an awful 7 hour delay arriving from Maui the staff were welcoming and efficient even in the early hours of the morning. Our Bay View room with stunning views and comfy bed was just what was needed. Of course it was the next morning when the views really wowed us. A view right over the bay, taking in Alcatraz and The Golden Gate, we were lucky that it was such a clear day as the common mist which we've encountered on previous trips to San Francisco would have made the room an expensive choice. The room itself was large and comfortable with a bath and walk in shower however the toiletries were basic and nondescript for such a hotel. The location was a good 10 minute walk to Union Square and was based in the business district. As our stay was on the weekend we found the area very quiet and the local starbucks and walgreens was shut the whole time, a bit annoying when you want a coffee or snacks in the evening. I enjoyed my stay here but would probably try a location nearer to Union Square next time.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: Notam
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a delightful hotel as part of a getaway prior to my partner starting cancer treatment, so we chose the MO. From booking to the farewell, every aspect of our stay was a hit. The reservations agent has been there since the property opened and was probably one of the best with whom I ever dealt. We advised the property that we would be arriving early and nature of our trip. Not only was the front desk able to accommodate us straight away when we arrived, but we were treated to some holistic information (with our permission, of course) for managing health pre and post cancer treatment. The personal touch was truly appreciated. As mentioned in earlier reviews, the bayview was stunning. The room was beautiful, spotless and (for us anyway) the Molton Brown toilettries are a hallmark of a great property. The welcome tea and almond cookies were appreciated. Room service was great and any call to the room was answered promptly. It's difficult find anything really significant to squawk about with our stay. On this trip we noticed the MO and another property we enjoyed this trip either had little or no information regarding coffee or tea in the room (even a card in the honor bar indicating coffee/tea must be requested from the front desk or dining room...we are still unsure which it is supposed to be.). The MO delivered on what we wanted for this trip and we both feel calm and focused for our next couple of weeks. Our stay renewed our love for SFO and it would be a pleasure to stay at the MO SFO again once we are able to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views!!”
Reviews.Author: LBR9
Reviews.Content: Located in the financial district, everything is closed over the weekend, have to walk that little bit further for coffee, etc. but it's not hideously far. The room is lovely, we were in a superior king room on the 47th floor, views of coit tower and beyond. The room was very nice; bed was comfy; lots of drawers and ample closet space; bathroom was lovely, Molten Brown products; windows that actually open, three telephones, lots of light. Staff all very pleasant and very helpful. Room service quality was good, menu is slightly limited - - especially the after hours menu. There are no movie channels, you can call down and have them bring DVD's up to you for selection - - -I believe these were free of charge. Overall excellent stay, would definitely stay there again. The "California" rate made it worth the money, having to pay full rack rate, I might think differently.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: SylvieTannhauser
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Mandarin Hotel in San Francisco and it was amazing. The service is excellent and the staff very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants quality service.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay their again for the views.”
Reviews.Author: Anfepool
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel for business or couples but not for families. The rooms are exceptionally clean and include all amenities. The bathrooms are spacious with bathtub and showers. Make sure to book a room with a bay view. The breakfast is a-la-carte and not a buffet breakfast, so everything you order is prepared fresh. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: stephaneiam
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Mandarin Hotel at San Francisco with great expectations. They fell short as soon as we arrived to the room. They gave us a handicap room, which was very uncomfortable. When we called the front desk they argued that the room was not handicap accessible and all of the rooms in the hotel were the same. I asked to speak to the manager and she continued to argue with us. Finnally I request to see other rooms because I could not belive they were all the same and to my surprise they where not. We lost an 1hr fighting about if the room was or not handicap accessible. Finnaly they manager would not even show to apolgize. They changed us rooms but never accepted that the room was actually handicap accessible. Mandarin Oriental is recognize for great service and this was not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful...San Francisco is a perfect picture postcard outside your windows!”
Reviews.Author: emprom
Reviews.Content: I love hotels. Always have! Pre-internet, I used to write to hotels for their brochures :) That's how much:) But today, this is not enough...and why we are here on tripadvisor. Our first trip away together as a couple had to be something special...and the choice of hotel in San Francisco caused me much research and debating :) Final choice: The Mandarin Oriental...mostly because of the views. We stayed in the Bridge to Bridge suite.... And we were not disappointed! On the contrary!! Of course people stay in hotels for different reasons...but to me it has to have something to do with the place I am visiting...and in San Francisco, I think the views are IT! As they say...a picture is worth a thousand words, so have a look at the photos attached...all taken from our room. Enough said!!! :) But I must also add that the staff was faultless...from the Reservations staff (Andrew!), to the reception staff, to the wonderful concierge team - all so efficient, polite, helpful and friendly. They helped us with everything from hiring a car before we had even arrived at the hotel, to securing tickets to a fantastic comedy show, as well as dinner reservations. Room service was also excellent as was the breakfast in the lovely Silk Restaurant . Verdict - A wonderful choice and most recommended :)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzim64
Reviews.Content: Great service, great room, unbelievable views, good summer deal for an expensive hotel, beautiful bathroom. We just loved everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: redback236
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nites at Mandarin Oriental, for 25 year wedding anniversary, July 24-27th, and we really enjoyed it! Whys: 1. We are 'local' bay area residents so we were able to take advantage of the room offer the hotel has for reduced rates. Also, the offer included parking for free and booking through Expedia we got a $50 master gas card! Can't beat that combo 2. Views from our room were spectacular--45th floor. Very quiet 3. Room was very large and spacious and the bathroom was all marble and huge! 4. Service was excellent...people were very friendly. To be honest, i was a bit hesitant to book Mandarin after reading an earlier trip advisor review complaining out indifferent staff, but i saw none of that. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to friends and we (my wife and me) will plan to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: EllaTheExplorer
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco is located in a nice quiet area, yet walkable to china town and only minutes to the cable cars. The room was VERY nice (for their standard room) and VERY clean! The hotel is a tall building so it works in your favor as far as views. The only thing I would recommend they work on is customer service. My husband and I rented a car for our day trip to napa valley, we had tasting appointments, etc and the car arrived to the hotel 30 minutes late...we paid $450 to rent the car and for it to arrive late was absolutely unfair. The hotel had actually booked the car later than we asked so it was their fault, yet when I asked to be compensated somewhat for the late delivery, they took my name and number and I NEVER GOT A CALL BACK! I called them several times from my room and they always had an excuse. I would agree with other negative reviews about the bad customer service, very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again - Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: pjbrad9
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service. The concierge will respond to your every request very promptly and eagerly. I was very impressed with how they responded when I asked if they could get a rental car for me. Within 20 minutes there was one waiting outside the hotel and I just had to sign the contract and take the keys. If you like to not have to lift a finger when you are on a vacation/getaway, this is a great place to stay. Also very clean and comfortable room with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View But Poor Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: trotter13
Reviews.Content: This is a hard to find hotel in the financial district. When I arrived the bellman said " you couldn't park there." I said "what I am checking in this hotel" he said "you are going to get a ticket.. " I said "Can I get my baggage out of my car?".. Finally I went to another bellman and said that guy said I cant park her but I need to check in.. He said "sorry" and when and got my luggage. I don't know if the was a language problem or what? But it not the usual greeting I get at hotels. I complained as I checked in and got a cool response apology. It was Valentine Day weekend and stayed in the Lotus Suite. I had flowers delivered and I noticed the bell man had them in his hand in a box.. I quietly said to him why do you have the flowers in your hand in a box, it supposed to be in the room as a surprise. He seemed not to understand as he puts the flower down on the dresser, I ask can I get a vase? It was a weird start to a trip at a 5 star hotel. The trip got better because the Lotus Room was simply beautiful and the view was spectacular out each window. I say through out my 3 day stay, I didn't find the front desk to be that friendly like other 5 star hotels, but the room made up for the lack of good customer service. A week after I the trip I received a request for a customer survey like many hotels send. I gave the hotel great marks besides customer service. When I marked down customer service then the survey ask me why low on customer service and I told them what happen when I arrived. Within a week I received a scolding letter from the hotel customer service supervisor mad because I marked them down in customer service. I couldn't believe it? They were saying will we investigated and they were making excuses for the bellman and said the bellman said he was sorry. Which didn't happen the other bellman said sorry for his co worker. But it wasn't just that incident that made me give low grades on customer service, it was the overall way they treated us. They didn't greet you as you pass the lobby, didn't rush to open the door as you came and they weren't that friendly or welcoming. I wasn't going to write a review on this hotel but when I got a scolding letter from the hotel because I marked them down was very insulting. When I wrote back and told them well I thought the customer service could be better and that I never got a apology from the bell man, they NEVER wrote back or responded to my letter it was like they just want to tell me off about my survey answers. The hotel has great views and the bed felt wonderful but just don't look for excellent customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR BRIDGE TO BRIDGE VIEW!!”
Reviews.Author: Audrey'sAuntie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a quick stay at the Mandarin Oriental in SF and we loved it!! The service from hotel staff was courteous with exceptional attention to detail, the decor was beautiful, the room was incredibly clean and our "Bridge to Bridge" view room on the 42nd floor was AMAZING!! And the beds were really comfortable. We loved the welcome jasmine tea and cookies too, yes, we're definitely going back! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wildeflowers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just spent 3 days in the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco. We absolutely loved the hotel and the location was perfect......very central, in walking distance to Market Street. Our room on the 39th floor had a spectacular bay view, the room itself was not too big and had a bit of a weird L-shape but nevertheless was cozy and had a very appealing asian-style decor. The beds were comfortable and bathroom was huge and modern.....reading some of the other reviews here I suppose, it must have been recently updated. The staff was superfriendly, helpful and efficient and we were very impressed by the fact that our rooms was cleaned every day about 5 minutes after we had left, although we never saw any cleaning staff in the hallways. Roomservice was fast and friendly, the only downside was the price for the food and the quality of. You end up paying 80 Dollars for two entrees plus one dessert - one entree I ordered was Spinach Ravioli for 15 Dollars plus all sorts of service fees which summed up to about 25 Dollars in total for that dish and what I got for it was four (!!) ravioli which were arranged nicely around three leaves of fresh spinach - ridiculous! The next day we tried simple penne pasta with tomato sauce which tasted pretty awful, because they obviously used the cheapest ready-made brand of tomato sauce that is available on the market...I had never expected that they would serve something like that in a first class hotel. I have to mention though that we a coupon for 50 Dollars worth of free meals per day....if I'd really had to pay myself for that, I would have felt seriously ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights after a week at the Omni as a 'treat' to myself. I'm sorry to say that my room here cost a lot more and offered a lot less. I won't make that mistake again. As with many high-end hotels, they nickeled and dimed you for everything. Room service was a rip off. Room was not all that luxurious. We got lucky and went out onto a balcony for a view while a staffer was out there, but usually those doors are locked. Fitness room was subpar. Best thing about it was drinks in the lounch downstairs. Overall, a terrific waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Way over-priced for what they offer.”
Reviews.Author: krscrm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for one night in the Mandarin King Bay room in SF. The rooms are nicely and elegantly decorated, and the windows are large and plentiful with good views of the city. I was dissapointed; however, that we did not recieve a room with views of the Golden Gate. I suppose I had to request this seperately. Anyway, the bed was big and comfy. Great pillows; I slept very well. The bathroom was my favorite. It had a large, deep tub overlooking the city. However, the tub is only big enough to fit one person at a time. The service was good; they were very attentive. Although I must warn you, you will get outrageously charged for everything you do. We wanted to eat at an Indian resturant, so we called the front desk and asked them directions to a nearby Indian place. They were very nice, and even printed out directions for us. However, when we checked-out, we saw that we had been charged $6.00 just for having someone tell us where to eat at. We also had room-service ordered. It was $80 for two entrees and an appetizer. Normally that wouldn't bother me if the food was good, but it was not. In fact, I couldn't even eat most of it because it was so gross. I had the pan-seared seabass. It was way over-cooked and was placed ontop of bland mashed potatoes and prego spaghetti sauce. We also had breakfast ordered the next morning. Breakfast was better, but it was still ridiculously expensive. $50 for two breakfast entrees. A glass of orange juice is $6.00! For a hotel that is so high-class, I was not expecting to pay such outrageous prices for something I could get elsewhere for much, much less. Also, everyone expetcs to be tipped. This gets tiring after a while. Oh, I should mention that in the morning we stopped by MO bar to get a water and a coke. The waiter brought out what I thought was complimentary biscottis along with our drinks because we did not request them. If I knew that we would be paying $9.00 for a water and a coke, there is no way we would have stopped at the bar. Overall, the hotel is beautiful and the service is good, but you will pay for it; and you will pay BIG. I will not stay here again. There are other high-class hotels that don't rape every cent out of you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Klocker
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had - stunning views of the city, top notch service, and very nice rooms with all of the amenities you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental. The courtesy car was a pleasant surprise and helped us save on taxi fares when going out to dinner at night. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional views and great service”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel, perched at the top of a skyscraper office builing in the Financial District. Walking distance to most things and a great location. The service is quick and complete. The views from the 1 BR suite were from bridge-to-bridge and simply gorgeous. The food was delicious, although the single restaurant, Silks, seemed to have more diners than waitstaff the day we had lunch there. The room was of a very high quality....not the most luxurious or over the top, but certainly VERY nice. Thoughtfull amenities were provided that made for a special touch. While the hallways are quiet there is little to no way to muffle the crash of closing doors outside the bedroom. The elvators have a long haul to get from the lobby to the rooms and are fast but there can be a wait. The staff was friendly, accommodating and attentive to all needs. It is much nicer than staying in Union Square and a very fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way”
Reviews.Author: yamanote
Reviews.Content: Stunning views from the well appointed and tasteful rooms and excellent service from the friendly staff makes the MOSF a no brainer for a luxury stay in downtown San Francisco. Sunrises and sunsets were awesome from the windows of our 47th floor room. The walk from the elevator to the room thru a glass window hallway gives one of the most breathtaking views of a city I have ever seen. Staff took care of all our requests beyond our expectations. For example, we were able to obtain a table for two at Michael Mina on the day despite a huge crowd of suited conventioneers in town. The hotel has a car and driver available for short trips to restaurants and venues in the downtown area. Its a nice luxury touch and we enjoyed chatting with the friendly driver. Highly recommend this hotel to those looking for a super luxury stay in downtown SF.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Luxury”
Reviews.Author: paravion0085
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Mandarin Oriental San Francisco, I was immediately greeted by a friendly doorman before stepping into the lobby of the hotel. An obsequious front desk attendant checked me in and proceeded to bring me up to my room to show me the amenities. While the hotel is housed in what I was told is the third tallest building in San Francisco, the lobby occupies the first floor while the rooms begin I believe somewhere on the high 30s floors. I had a Queen Bay View Room, located on the 41st floor, which allowed unparalleled views of the Transamerica tower, Coit tower, Alcatraz, the Bay Bridge, and the Golden Gate Bridge. There were so many sights to photograph from the room window alone! Luxe Amenities: Hot tea and cookies are presented shortly after arrival. Two different options for bathrobes: one terrycloth, one chunky waffle weave. Slippers and elegant turn down service nightly, along with bottled water presented bedside. Molton Brown toiletries were excellent. Fabulous points: Concierge was amazing and recommended great places to shop, how to differentiate between the trolleys, cable cars, and other modes of transport in the city, where to eat, and also arranged at the spur of the moment for an almost private tour of the city on an 8-person bus. This tour was exhaustive in terms of the areas we explored and the guide was able to take pictures and provide us with even more suggestions for restaurants and places to visit. The van drove us all over the city and we stopped to get out at the more critical spots. It lasted two to three hours and was a very reasonable $50. Back at the hotel, the fresh apples by the elevator were a nice touch, as was the impeccable service which even extended to the cleaning staff. Concerns: I travel very lightly (I only brought one carry-on and a messenger bag on my trip) but even I was surprised at how little drawer space they provided. There were a few at the bottom of the closet but it was tough to locate any others. There was a floor lamp located near the desk which I needed to use for the added light at night, but I had to plug it in myself (very minor concern, obviously). To access the internet, I had to call the front desk and then was transferred to a tech support line, and surprisingly was never charged the access fee at check-out. Also, one major concern (although it provided a bit of comical relief one morning) was that I could hear EVERYTHING the neighbors did in their room. Now, either my neighbors were very loud, or the hotel's walls need a bit more insulation added in the next renovation. Overall: The views from the room make the stay worth every bit of the cost (which drops drastically if you stay any nights between Friday and Sunday as it's primarily a business hotel). I found the location very convenient to SoMa, Union Square, the Farmer's Market at the Embarcadero, and everything else in the city. However, I would not stay at this hotel if a big draw for you is a bustling hotel atmosphere, particularly at night. This hotel is so amazing in part because it is almost museum-like in its quietness (bawdy neighbors aside). While I am also inclined to visit the St. Regis or the Four Seasons for my next trip to San Francisco, the Mandarin's price drop on weekends, mixed with the superlative quality of the views (and the envious looks you get when you mention where you're staying) make it a must to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, Courteous Service, Total Comfort A+++”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: Continuing our journey for our Christmas/New Year's Eve vacation my wife and daughter and I just spent 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. It was an amazingly comfortable stay. I booked this hotel over the Ritz and Four Season Hotels which are also great because I'm a sucker for a great view. I'm not sure if it gets much better than this. We booked a Lotus Suite and it had a panoramic view of the city. It was an amazing view both during the day but especially at night. We were on the 45th floor and it was very nice that our room had its own private hallway giving additional privacy. It had a normal doorbell on it as well. The room was VERY spacious. From the moment we checked in the staff was very friendly and professional. I've never stayed at this property before and we were coming from the Ritz Carlton in Naples, Florida and an amazingly upscale house that we stayed in Los Angeles before coming here so we had very high expectations. The hotel lobby is nothing to write home about. Not bad but nothing extra special. The real "magic" begins when you rocket up to your rooms in the fast elevators that take you up to your room. I believe most of the rooms have a view but the suites with the really great views are on the 40th floor or higher. Our King size bed was very very comfortable and had a big floor to ceiling window at the side of it so you can keep the curtains open all night and see the skyline. It was extremely romantic! Also, the room had a nice working area (although this was probably the first time in 10 years that I didn't work during a vacation). We have a 5 month old baby which sure does change your priorities and focus in life. This was a great trip with her and the family. Speaking of which the hotel had a baby crib set up for little Katie. The bathroom was very high end and all marble. The room had high speed wireless internet you could buy. I only used it 1 out of the 4 nights. The cost was $12.95 per night and it did seem to work very well. This place certainly isn't cheap. You can spend quite a lot of money here as things add up. For example, they charged a whopping $50 a night for valet parking. That is a bit steep I thought but then again, all around in San Francisco parking was scarce and VERY expensive. If we didn't have a baby with us and stroller I would never have had a car. Most places charged $27 to park 2 hours and that is IF you can find a space. The room was totally comfortable and I doubt you will find a hotel with a better view in San Francisco than the Mandarin Oriental. They do a great job and always go out of their way to help you. Every morning they put the Wall Street Journal, USA Today and London Financial Times under my door when I told them I read them. The room also has a nice LCD TV and also has a DVD player in it which we used. It is a bit awkward as you can't control the DVD from the bed as it's inside the drawer so they might want to change that. They had twice a day full maid service and they did a great job each day. The first day we flew in it was cloudy and we were disappointed that we spent so much money to get a great view and we couldn't see anything. But then God must have answered our prayers as the rest of the stay the weather was glorious and we got tons of amazing photos near the Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Nob Hill and other areas. San Francisco is truly one of the most beautiful cities in the world. I give an A++ for this hotel and the great service as they always were going out of their way to help. We are off back to Los Angeles for a night then heading back to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “The best views in the Bay Area.”
Reviews.Author: vacationloveruk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the height of the hotel and the views we would get. The hotel is on a busy street and as it is in the top half a skyscraper it doesn't have a pulling in area to unload, but the vallet was helpfull and took our car for parking. Check in was easy and the lobby was nice, but not spectacular. The suite was lovely. A seating area, a double bed, plasma screen, large bathroom with tub and shower. Three huge windows with views from the Golden Gate to the Bay. They brought us free tea to drink in the suite on arrival. The concieage reccomened the best eating areas for dinner and provided us with a free Mercedes S Class limo to ferry us around town. He dropped us off at the restaurant and picked us up later. Nice touch. The next morning the conciage suggested a nice place to get Sunday Brunch, and it was great. Very helpfull people. When we checked out after a two night stay we left our un stamped post cards in the room. I called the hotel and they put stamps on an mailed them Free. I thought this was a nice gesture. Overall San Fran has many nice hotels, but I can't think of a simple one that is both Five Star and has these views. It is expensive, but deals are to be had. Or you could book a standard room and ask for a free upgrade, maybe slip the front desk staff a $20 bill, and see what happens. Usually works for us.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: eastbayboy
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Mandarin Oriental for my post-engagement proposal night with my new fiance. I reserved a Executive Corner City View room, but was generously upgraded to a room with views of both bridges. I needed time to set up the room, so I was allowed to check in at 1pm which was integral for my evening plans. Once I arrived, the staff was excellent the entire time. The complementary tea in the room was a great touch. I mentioned in my reservation that we were getting engaged, so a beautiful box of chocolates with a "congratulations" label was left for us. The service that we enjoyed was far superior to the Omni and Fairmont that we've frequented in the past. The hotel is expensive, but for special nights, you should definitely splurge and stay at the MO.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and perfectly Asian hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a high end hotel in Asia you'll know what I mean. The MO is all quiet, discrete but perfect service. The room was nice, a bit small and oddly laid out (I couldn't tell from the exterior but there must be some odd angles to the building). Nice lobby bar with a good selection of food/drinks. Handy location to business in the financial district as well as the Ferry Building and the Embarcadero.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, loved the views”
Reviews.Author: calisunkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place to stay for anyone. We stayed in the Taipan suite and it was fabulous. As nice a room as you will find anywhere. The terrace was nice but it was cloudy on the days we were there. How unfortunate but I suppose these things happen. The front desk was in shambles though, I waited a long time to check in and they just seemed to lack confidence in what they were doing. Perhaps some training? The front desk is the first and last impression you will have, It’s just a shame to have someone leave with a bad thoughts about such a great property. Try the restaurant it is very good. The location wouldn't be that great if you were a tourist but my husband had meetings all day so it worked out well for us. Definitely worth your time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: Marta Hari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the Financial District. It occupies the 38th to 48th floors of a block and therefore has fantastic views. We had a bayview room and spent ages just looking out of the window. The hotel supplies binoculars. Service was impeccable, jasmin tea in your room on arrival and assistance with anything you needed. Easy walk to ferry terminal and famers market and Chinatown and well connected for transport elswhere. If 2 people are staying more than one night maybe a king size room would be better but we were only there for one night and the queen size was fine Beautiful bathroom too, stuffed wilth Molton Brown Couldn't fault it

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, made unbeatable by the staff”
Reviews.Author: Quagm1re
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the mandarin oriental and we weren't disappointed. We booked a bridge to bridge room and it was worth the money on the view alone. I do not think there is a finer view anywhere in San Francisco and I think the view from this particular room even beats that of the more expensive bay bridge room we stayed in last time. As you would expect for this standard of hotel the quality of the room and amenities was first rate. The furnishings are exquisite and give a real flavour of the orient. However the one thing that really sets this hotel apart are the staff. Their ability to make you feel welcome and special is unrivalled by anywhere else I have stayed in the world. They are clearly highly trained and have an almost unnerving talent for anticipating your needs. Goven the choice I will not stay anywhere else in San Francisco. Negatives - if I must nitpick i suppose the food and drinks are expensive, but then again would you expect anything else??

Reviews.Title: “An above average hotel with exceptional views”
Reviews.Author: BuryFoodLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a bridge to bridge room on the 48th floor (room 4811) for three nights during September. I booked the room expecting spectacular views and was not disappointed. The room was well appointed, of a reasonable size (I had toyed with the idea of a suite but thought the short stay did not warrant it) and generally satisfactory for a chain hotel. An initial word of warning - the hotel is a little hard to spot; if you expect a large frontage you will go directly past it, as we did. Once we found the entrance, first impressions of the hotel were good; we were greeted politely and our car was promptly parked and our luggage unpacked. The first warning of one of the minor problems with the hotel was the wait for the elevator – there are only two servicing the hotel and, while the Mandarin Oriental does not cover all 48 floors of the building, there can be a considerable wait, especially at peak times such as breakfast and dinner. Another note of caution I would proffer is that bridge to bridge rooms all have interconnecting doors with adjacent rooms, thus offering families the opportunity to link more than one room during a stay. This is, of course, of benefit to families wishing so to do, however, for those needing a full night’s sleep, the noise that comes through the door can be an unwelcome disturbance – we were woken on two mornings at 6am by our early rising neighbour’s television. I complained to the front desk, albeit not forcibly, and asked what could be done. Their first suggestion, placing a pillow against the door, was as laughable as it was derisory. Subsequently I was told no other rooms with similar views, I had made this a prerequisite, were available. While I understood and accepted the explanation, I was a touch put out by the lack of apology or indeed the option to upgrade the room. The restaurant on the second floor, Silks, is of a high standard and the meal we had there was one of the highlights of our trip to California – it exceeded our expectations and bettered many of the establishments we visited that had boasted multiple Michelin Stars. The highlight of the meal, indeed three of the four of us dining chose it, was the exquisite scallop and pork belly starter. The sommelier was well trained and recommended an exceptional wine to accompany our meal – in fact he chose something cheaper than the bottle I had sought his opinion on. Breakfast was also of a high standard and I would recommend the ‘Green eggs and ham’ without hesitation. In addition, the barman at the bar on the ground floor provided excellent service and gave sound recommendations. We found the front desk staff of mixed ability and demeanour. The concierge was a delight to deal with and he helpfully made reservations for us and printed off various pieces of information without hesitation. In contrast, the main front desk team seemed rather inexperienced and some struggled a little with spoken English. All in all, the Mandarin Oriental is a great hotel to stay in if one is visiting San Francisco, however, it is not a destination in itself. The views aside, there are thousands of hotels across the globe that do exactly the same thing at exactly the same sort of price. It is an above average hotel which is perfect for business travellers and those with a reason to be in San Francisco, we we’re visiting family, but do not make it the focus of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to get married!”
Reviews.Author: Debster48
Reviews.Content: I recently attended my son's wedding at the Mandarin Oriental. The rooms were beautiful -- as a room should be at prices in excess of $300.00/night. The problem was in the dealings with the hotel management. We found them to be inflexible in every way. The wedding took place on a beautiful terrace overlooking the city of San Francisco. After the reception, the professional photographer wanted to take some twilight photos of the bride and groom on the terrace. Unfortunately, the door to the outdoor terrace had been locked, and the hotel representative was unwilling to unlock the door for photographs because, "it was not in the original contract." This wedding cost well over $20,000, including 8 rooms that were reserved for guests, and my son was charged additional fees for every slight change that was made to the original reservation. There was also an issue involving the suite that my son had originally reserved for his wedding night. He had selected a specific suite because of the view; however, the hotel gave the suite to another guest who wanted to stay in the room for a longer period of time. My son and his bride were given a less desireable room on the other side of the hotel. We were disappointed that the Mandarin Oriental was so unaccommodating when so much money had been spent for this special occasion. Beautiful hotel, but very expensive and inflexible.

Reviews.Title: “great view, pretty good service, tired and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: daratillot
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bay view room. It had a spectacular view of the bay, the Golden Gate bridge and Alcatraz. The room itself was kind of tired. The bathroom was small, had one sink, and didn't feel fresh or particularly clean. It felt old, and the water pressure in the shower was a joke, beyond water saver and into water miser. The service was mixed, some great (room service) and some not so great (front desk.) It definitely wasn't worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great...”
Reviews.Author: bule1101
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, by any standards. Very nice rooms and great views. But its not up to par to other Mandarin hotels we visited (Prague, Miami, Munich)... The service was average with no real care or attention... The location is also just ok, but its quite a walk to any sights or shopping... Will choose the Four Seasons or St Regis for our next stay as they are closer to the action...

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to San Francisco...”
Reviews.Author: twoginsonetonic
Reviews.Content: I should have known from the outset when reservations at first agreed and then refused to honour this Mandarin Oriental's stay two nights get one free deal with American Express Centurion - apparently because the room category which we wished to book was too high. As well documented, the hotel occupies the upper levels of a tower block. First impressions were not good - the lobby is dark and shabby and light years away from other Mandarins such as in Miami. Things did not improve when we entered our Dynasty Suite - the rooms were dark and the layout not at all attractive. Whilst the soft furnishings had supposedly recently been upgraded, the decor in the two bathrooms was shocking - poor lighting, seventies' style mini tiles in the shower and the shower head height located somewhere around my chest. On our floor at least, the rooms were laid out in a barbell with approximately six in a cul de sac formation at each end of the hotel. This very quickly became an issue when we became aware of the sound proofing in the suite - there is none. With our bed headboard adjacent to the hallway door, we were consistently bombarded by the thud of bedroom doors slamming closed. Having just arrived from a transatlantic flight, we were looking forward to relaxing and catching up on some sleep on the first few days of our vacation - forget it. The non-stop din of housekeeping and other guests coming and going ensured that we left shattered after three days of disrupted sleep. The dining room, where we had breakfast, continued to same dark and tired theme perpetuated throughout the property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mushmouser
Reviews.Content: I'm a local to the SF Bay area and have stayed here twice (July 08 & Nov. 05) with visiting out of town family. We have all enjoyed it greatly both times. My family stays at many up scale resorts and hotels and raves about this place and I agree with them. Each time we stayed, the rooms were a bit different. We got 2 rooms, adjoining, each time. One for my sis and hubby and one for me and their kids (I'm fill in nanny when they go on vacation...). Their rooms were always nicer than the kid's room, but even the kid's room was superb. The views each time awesome; the master bath astounding, most recently with a bathtub that overlooked the city. The tea upon arrival most inviting and soothing (hot chocolate was provided for the kids and was some of the best we've had). Have a drink in the bar - they have some very tasty and original cocktails. We did not hear any noise either stay. And, yes, it is dead in the financial district on the weekends and after 7 or 8 during the week. If you're into nightlife, take a cab or the hotels complimentary shuttle, if available. Everyone should stay here at least once. It is a little pricey, but worth it in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great views!”
Reviews.Author: Spacrawler
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at the Mandarin Oriental for a quick leisure trip to San Francisco. I spent many hours trying to decide where to stay. On my last trip in June I chose the Four Seasons; it was a superlative experience and a good value to boot. But I wanted something different. I originally booked the St. Regis, but the numerous Trip Advisor comments about noise worried me; the location of the Ritz Carlton does not appeal to me, so sort of by default that got me to the Mandarin Oriental. After reading all the reviews of this property, I can say that I understand both the positive and the negative comments. No hotel is perfect (or at least I haven't been there yet!), so it really depends on what you value for your money. Let me start with the positives. 1. As everyone says, the view is unbeatable. I had an executive king with a view south and west. I could see some of the Bay Bridge, but very little of the Golden Gate. If that view is important to you, you need to book a higher category room. Expect to pay $100-200 more per night for that privilege. And, as others have noted, there is no guarantee that you will have that view if there is thick fog, as there was for most of my stay. 2. I loved the layout and decor of the room. In fact, I was shown a bridge to bridge room and a Mandarin king (the pricey one) and the living area in my room was more spacious. The color scheme (red, gold, white) is cheerful yet soothing. The furnishings, art work, throw pillows, bamboo plant, sheer blinds, etc. are all lovely. The bed linens were top of the line, really, really silky smooth. Great air conditioning, although I'm not sure I really needed it in the chilly August fog. 3. The hotel is very quiet for a big city. I think being on the 41st floor keeps out a lot of street noise. I heard doors in the halls, but not people, even on a fully booked Saturday night. There are only about 15 rooms per floor, divided by the walkway, so there just aren't that many guests to make noise. Now for the not so good. 1. As a luxury hotel bathroom junkie, the M.O. was a bit disappointing. Mine was a bit small, with a very narrow tub. There are appeared to be three types of wall covering, the ugliest of which is in the separate shower. In the other rooms I saw the walls of the separate shower were marble where mine was just ugly yellow tile. The Mandarin King bath with the tub by the window is lovely, but it does not compare to the bath at the Four Seasons. The towels were a bit scratchy and I didn't care for the toiletries. I went from two bathmats on the first day, to one on the second to none of the third. Housekeeping must have forgotten. But the room itself was super clean. 2. The public areas of the hotel are sort of dark and pretty small. I don't spend time in public areas, so this didn't matter to me. But the appeal of the hotel is on the upper floors. It's really too bad that Silks has no natural light windows because it is a pretty space. 3. I was on a breakfast package so I had two meals in Silks and one from room service. They were okay. Be aware that you are kept to a $32 per per person maximum for the package. At the Four Seasons they just paid whatever I spent (one breakfast upwards of $50). 4. For the non-smokers: this hotel is pretty lax about smoking in rooms. I was told the only floor where smoking was allowed was on the 48th, but there was definitely a fresh cigarette smell in my 41st floor room on Saturday night. One of the staff told me that they don't charge people for smoking in non-smoking rooms as there are a lot of Asian and European clients who smoke. I found this annoying. 5. No wifi the rooms, ethernet connection only. Not enough information about TV channels and no info on PPV. 6. The staff did not impress me much. Check in was chaotic -- the person serving me seemed not to know what she was doing, and there was a problem processing my credit card. It turns out it was the M.O. system and not my card, but the 15 minutes spent trying to figure this out was embarassing and annoying. I found the breakfast server unfriendly. But these negatives do not outweigh the positives, and all things considered, I would definitely stay here again. The price was reasonable for a luxury hotel in one of the world's greatest cities, and I really, really loved the room. The pictures posted on trip advisor and on the hotel website are accurate. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation!”
Reviews.Author: tziambra
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a nice hotel in SF and we decided on the Mandarin Oriental, though usually, we try the Four Seasons. We were told by friends that live there that the Four Seasons was in a not very nice area so we settled on the Mandarin Oriental. The service was superb, as expected, very professional and friendly, from the check-in to the concierge and everybody else. The room was very nice, decorated with an Asian touch but modern (mentioning this cause the Oriental in Bangkok was a bit too much for me), the bathroom was huge and had Molton Brown products and the best part was the view. Even though we were not on the best side of the hotel in terms of the view, it was still pretty breathtaking. I loved the small things that make the difference, they brought us tea upon arrival in this perfect looking basket, the room had a flat screen TV and a DVD player so we got a movie to watch on Sunday night. The only thing that I found annoying was the parking, of course there is a garage but it is 50 USD per night, I guess to be expected in that city but I still thought it was a lot. During the weekend, you can park on the street but not on weekdays. We managed to park in another garage for 30 USD, a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “what a view!”
Reviews.Author: sccarlin
Reviews.Content: Fabulous views from the 38th floor and up. Very comfortable rooms. Very good, friendly service. Very expensive though. Hotel parking at $45 a night?! Come on. Hotel itself needs some refurbishing.elevators and acrpets look a little worn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Critical_Mind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin in San Fran twice - at the beginning and at the end of our trip to the US West Coast. The service - starting from the check-in to the cleaning service - was impeccable, smooth and just perfect. Upon arrival, we checked into a stunning room which had wonderful views across the bay, the Golden Gate bridge and the City. Fantastic facilities. We were greeted with fresh jasmine tea and biscuits. The Hotel's facilities are good - it lacks a health club unfortunately - but we were more than compensated by the service and the room. In particular, Mandarin's concierges are superb. They will go that extra mile to make your stay special. Not only did we receive fantastic recommendations for restaurants (Chaya), they also provided a gift wrapping service and much more. Overall, the staffs' attention to detail is striking and I cannot false the hotel in any way. Make sure you get a room with a view over the bay. Quick summary: Location - very good - you can reach the waterfront, Union Square and Nob Hill in no time Facilities - good (no health club/spa, but there is one across the street which you can access) Atmosphere - good (it is a business hotel) Service - outstanding Rooms - outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Five Star Hotel -Service is Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: miller041
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The room had all of the usual perks: the fabulous sheets and tasteful furnishings of a 5 star hotel, but what really set this hotel apart was the amazing service and fabulous views.The view from our room and from the hallways leading to our room on the 48th floor were worth the price alone. The location was within easy walking distance to the wonderful Saturday Farmer’s market at the Ferry Building (go early and follow the line of people headed for the homemade Mexican breakfast on the back side of the market). The California line of the cable car line is just down the block, pay $11 each and ride to the end of the line and back as many times as you want just for the experience, fun to do very late at night. And a taxi was rarely more than $10 from this hotel to places in town. Deserves every one of its five stars for the accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perch for July 4 Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights over July 4 holiday weekend in a Bay View Queen, which was a steal at $295 per night. The queen rooms aren't huge, but are certainly comfortable enough and the bathrooms are quite large even in this smaller room category. The absolutely spectacular view, taking in the "greatest hits" of San Francisco--Transamerica Pyramid, Coit Tower, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate--makes the room feel larger. From my room, I could lie in bed and look at the GG in the distance. I also had a perfectly-framed view of the fireworks down at the Embarcadero. The lobby is smallish, but the greeting staff is top-notch and you will feel like a cherished guest every time you enter or exit. The lounge is just off the lobby and can't quite escape its '80s layout, but there is a great deal of seating so you could usually get a quiet table. Bar staff is professional and attentive. Dinner at Silks, tucked away by itself on the 2nd floor, was a relaxed, calming, and delicious evening. The restaurant's more of a lunch spot, so evenings tend to be quiet. The chef's tasting menu was wonderfully creative and had four well-sized courses plus three amuse-bouche servings, including a post-dessert combo of hot chocolate and bitter German beer that was an innovative meal-ender. I had figured the price was so good on the holiday because of the Financial District location being a bit off the usual tourist path. However, I found the location to be quite convenient. It was a five-minute walk from the Montgomery St. BART station, a ten-minute walk from the Ferry Building [you must try Cowgirl Creamery], and ten-minute walk [straight up] to Nob Hill.
