If you're a hotel junkie like me, you can explore the Fairmont [lethal rum drinks at the Tonga Room], the Mark Hopkins, the Ritz-Carlton, and the Huntington all in one easy loop once on Nob Hill. Other SF must-dos: Dinner at Gary Danko will leave you reaching for superlatives; Cafe Claude is a nifty French bistro on the edge of Chinatown; a bay cruise under the Golden Gate bridge is awe-inspiring. All in all, even with the many great hotels in SF, I would feel very comfortable returning to the Mandarin Oriental. The complimentary basket of green tea and cookies on arrival set a welcoming tone that continued through my stay. As some others have commented, there was often a wait for an elevator, but that's the only negative comment I have.

Reviews.Title: “Outsanding!!”
Reviews.Author: tigerider
Reviews.Content: Visited this property for the first time on July 4th. The customer service was outstanding! From the moment we entered the small, welcoming lobby we were greeted and promptly helped. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. The room was amazing. Clean. Spacious. View. Bed. Shower. Everything. There was even a refreshing smell as you entered the room that was immediately noticed. Everything in the room was in great shape, perfectly placed and well decorated. Concierge was great helping us find a pub for dinner/drinks and brunch the next day. The only thing we noticed that seemed a distraction was the lack and speed of the elevators. There are only 2 that service the top floors where the hotel rooms are. They were busy and you had to wait a few minutes each way. But, in comparison to the other things this place offered.. it was nothing to worry about! Will return without question.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: insomniac06
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel 4 hours prior to check-in time and they still had our room ready for us! Our intital impression of the hotel was that it was very luxurious and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a bridge to bridge room, and as you can see from my photos, we had a spectacular view of the city! The room was immaculately clean, tidy and beautiful. Soon after check in, some Chinese tea and cookies were delivered to us and we were offered a room demonstration (we declined this but it still was a nice touch). We went out for a few hours but made sure we got back to the room in time for sunset, which was breathtaking. We were able to walk to Union Square in 10 minutes. Rooms were equipped with free internet access, a widescreen television and a fully stocked minibar. The bathroom was large and had a walk in shower as well as a bathtub. Molten Brown toiletries were supplied which was a bonus! We decided we didn't want to leave the room and opted for room service dinner. We ordered chicken noodle soup, a cheeseburger, fillet mignon (with garlic fries), and chocolate fondant cakes for dessert. It was quite pricey but delicious and nice for a one off treat. Check out was quick and convienent, with the staff taking good care of our transport requirements to the airport. This hotel was fabulous and I would definitely reccomend that you stay there, even for just one night. I will no doubt be in San Francisco again, and if my budget can stretch to it, the Mandarin will be on the top of my hotel list:)

Reviews.Title: “A GEM”
Reviews.Author: bellgriffin
Reviews.Content: What more can you say about the best hotel in town.Everything a good hotel should do for its guests,but this hotel does it better. The staff treat you as family and good friends

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Warwick1971
Reviews.Content: It was the first stop of our my Honeymoon... booked on site and reviewed. It is expensive but if you can stretch the budget do it. We were on the 48th floor on a corner , the room was fab , staff , very helpful, friendly etc .I would really give this place 10 out of 10. , good central position also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PoppyTT
Reviews.Content: Located in the CBD with fabulous views of the city. We stayed in a bridge to bridge view room on the 44th room. A luxury room with a big bathroom. Couldn't have asked for anymore! The staff were helpful and polite. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A view of the Bridge”
Reviews.Author: DMH154
Reviews.Content: We have frequently flown to San Francisco this last year on family business. Of four hotels that we have stayed in we now have a strong preference for the Mandarin. The Mandarin takes up the top floors of one of the tallest buildings in San Francisco. If you stay there you are very likely to have a spectacular water view. That is something that is oddly difficult to find in San Francisco hotels. The service at the hotel is excellent-- fast, unpretentious, quiet and low key. The decor is understated, oriental influenced and well designed with an intelligent lay-out that contributes to the feeling of spaciousness. They handled our rental car quickly and efficiently In SF we have stayed at the Four Seasons, the Ritz Carlton and the Omni in the last year and liked all of them except the Four Seasons, (which is grim) but when we return, we intend to book at the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SaintKaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental SF for 2 days at the beginning of our trip to california . This was the 3rd Mandarin Oriental we have stayed at and like the other's it did not disappoint . One of the reasons we chose it was that as we were staying at a weekend it would be quiet in the financial District and we needed a couple of really good nights sleep to acclimatise to the different time zone. That is exactly what we did, the room was very quiet and the bed very comfortable. We stayed in a deluxe room and it was a good size and the bathroom was huge. All staff members we met were very helpful & friendly . Great views from the walkway. The only down side is at the weekends alot of the local restaurants & coffee shops are closed on the weekends, but on weekdays there are plenty of places to go . We would definitely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: NYCBeachLover
Reviews.Content: I escaped for one night to San Francisco to visit a friend and unwind, and the Mandarin definitely helped with unwinding with attentive staff and a luxurious room. The hotel is on top of an office building, on floors 40-48, and this means there are some amazing views, especially from the hallway connecting the 2 towers. My room was upgraded from a deluxe to executive deluxe simply by asking at check-in: weekends are slow at this business-oriented hotel. The upgrade meant I got a corner room with 3 large windows and lots of sunlight. Highlights of the room include an extremely comfortable bed and a large, flat-panel, HDTV with actual HD channels on the cable - something many hotels don't bother with. There's also a DVD player attached. The bathroom had a shower stall with great water pressure and a separate tub. Service from the staff was great, with a welcoming tea upon arriving in my room and a well-presented room service breakfast. Sight-seeing suggestions were well described and mapped out by the concierge. The main item lacking from the hotel is a spa. There is a moderate-sized workout room in the hotel, and diagonally across the street is a full-service gym and spa. The location is 2-3 blocks from BART, so access is easy from both Oakland and SFO airports via public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff can't be this good?”
Reviews.Author: Tusters
Reviews.Content: Our first stop on a Californian tour in February was this hotel. We booked a twin bridges room, stunning views of the two bridges and the City, way up on the 42nd floor! Our first contact with the Hotel was with Michael Dunlap the Concierge, who planned our stay and eating. We eat at two awesome restaurants, did a touristy city tour, and just soaked up San Francisco from this magnificent and very comfortable hotel. Sure, it is expensive - but the staff genuinely smile with a warmth so special that you feel a million bucks! Nothing was too much trouble...... a great and very comfortable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Addison_texasWendyw
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Mandarin Oriental hotel is service, service, service. This is the way all guests should be treated! Everyone we came in contact with associated with this hotel were friendly and extremely pleasant. The rooms were fine - loved the beds and linens. We had perfect weather which really added to the spectacular views from our room. If you have a fear of heights, this is not the hotel for you! I would not recommend eating dinner at Silks- was not impressed at all. It's fine for breakfast. We will defnitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in while in SF”
Reviews.Author: l2k
Reviews.Content: I found myself in the financial district in San Francisco last weekend without a place to stay and was wandering near the Mandarin, so I stopped in to see what they had in terms of availability. In short, the entire experience was superb from the moment I approached the property to day I left. The doorman was courteous, the bellhop was friendly and the extremely helpful and professional receptionist had me in a room on the 45th floor in short order. Not only was the room fantastic - stunning view, comfortable and inviting bed, impeccable furnishings - the service was top notch as well. From chatting with me, the receptionist gathered I'd flown in recently and had the concierge contact me to inquire if I'd eaten. After telling him I had not, he quickly managed to procure a reservation for me at an amazing spot *and* got me great table as well (which I don't know how he managed, given the place was absolutely packed). Simply put, if you feel like being pampered, check out the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: buj94565
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the mandarin oriental on a friday night...check out their website...they might have weekend specials. anyway...i stayed so that i wouldn't have to drive home after theatre. the hotel is located in the heart of the financial district which is quiet on the weekends and it's within walking distance of sf's finest shopping...chinatown is within walking distance too... it isn't that close to the theatres...but...a short taxi ride. the room was incredibly clean and the furnishings were in very good condition. the bed was very comfortable, the room smelled fresh...not like lysol. the bathroom is marble with a shower ad tub. have you seen pic's of rooms that looked great...but...when you see the real room its "shopworn" and dingy around the edges...well...the mandarin was spotless. the view was spectacular...all the rooms start on top floors... parking was a bit pricy...but...very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay...”
Reviews.Author: nephalion
Reviews.Content: Every time I visit San Francisco I try to stay at the Mandarin. My first visit just blew my mind and things have not changed with age. This visit nearly did not happen due to an email miscommunication between myself and a member of the MO team. But we managed to resolve our differences very amicably (and all my own fault really) and I got the room I wanted for an acceptable price. It has to be said the MO is not cheap. Especially when you are a leisure traveller and not on business expenses! But the service is exceptional, the MO people always appear genuinely pleased to see you and make your stay really pleasant. You feel special every time you walk in. After service and hospitality the next best thing is... the views. This hotel has the best views of San Francisco you have ever seen and an upgrade to a room with a Golden Gate view is well worth it. The views are indescribable. I knew what to expect, but it still takes my breath away, my girlfriend had not been and was, as I anticipated, stunned! As I did on my first visit, she sat and drank in the views for an hour after we arrived :-) I do love the place and will always try to visit if and when I am in the area although I would note there are one or two very small niggles starting to appear. I doubt they will remain for long and do not spoil anything but things like the heat lamp timer in the bathroom being from the 80's and the TV speaker in the bathroom not working were surprising. But Ia) who really needs those things and b) I repeat... the hotel is still fantastic! The turn down service is wonderful and when you return in the evening it feels like home (although I urge you to open the curtains again to take in the sensational night time city view). Being in the financial district the hotel is well placed for all transport, including a tram at the end of the block. Close to the bay and very close to the main shopping centres. Not so close to Fishermans Wharf but that's not such a bad thing. I can't wait to return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Statikfeed
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a wonderful hotel. My wife and I stayed there after getting married before leaving to Hawaii and we were treated very well. The staff is very attentive and the rooms are great. We stayed in the bridge to bridge room and it was a wonderful site. Very romantic and a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Simply - THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: Boy, it's going to be tough to write this review. I am not sure I can gush enough about this fine hotel. When you drive up, the hotel is not overdone, it's simple. The hotel sent a car to the airport for us and the car alerted the hotel we were coming. The manager and a assistant greeted us on the sidewalk. Our check in was done in the room, we never had to stop by the front desk. Then hot tea arrived the room with Asian cookies. The kids had stuffed animals and baseball caps on their beds! We had two rooms, the larger room had a stunning bay view. Our bathroom had a tub that overlooked the bay. I can't tell you how relaxing it was to soak in a hot tub and have the whole city of San Francisco below you! This is one hotel I could just sit in the hotel room and never leave. The service is top rate. You don't have to ask for anything, some how the staff seems to understand what you need and they do cartwheels to make you happy. The staff in my view is one of the best group of hotel employees in the world. The concierge staff is the best in the world. They suggested restaurants and treated the kids like family. We were offered the hotel car for dinner and never had to get a cab to go anywhere. This is exactly what a dream hotel stay should be. Perfect rooms, wonderful views, attentive staff and San Francisco. I can't describe how perfect our stay at this hotel was....I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “You'll love the attention to detall at the Mandarin Oriental.”
Reviews.Author: ellablu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recenlty stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco. We have stayed at M.O. before in New York and fell in love with their attention to service. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and offered complimentary tea service. We asked for early check in and were granted early check in at 11:00 a.m. We were greeted by hotel employees as we entered and exited the hotel. They were very warm and friendly and even greeting us by name. Our room had a wonderful view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Coit Tower. We had our tea service in the afternoon after a day of shopping. The tea pot arrived in a large basket along with almond cookies. After we came back from dinner, cold water was waiting for us along with slippers next to our bed. We had a wonderful stay. My only issue was our neighbors who departed in the middle of the night. They were very loud and entered and exited their room several times before departure. The clock alarm also went off at 5:00 a.m. so I guess the last guest forgot to turn it off. I finally took the battery out since I couldn't figure out how to turn it off at 5:00 a.m. in the dark. Minus these few events which the hotel had no control of we had a great stay. I would advise that some local restaurants were closed when we arrived. I believe that since this is a business area that some small restaurants are closed on the weekends. This is not a big deal since you will want to experience the wonderful restaurants in other parts of the city especially Micheal Mina at the Westin St. Francis. Hands down my favorite restaurant. The attention to detail at this restaurant is amazing. The lobster pot pie is to die for. When we departed the hotel we were offered coffee to go.

Reviews.Title: “Superb views”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireMash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our trip from New York (we drove across, via Seattle) as we decided that we deserved some luxury after all those middle-of-nowhere motels! We booked a Bridge to Bridge room which had a 180 degree view from the Golden Gate to the Oakland Bay Bridge, and it really was amazing! The hotel itself is in the business district but the area had quite a lot of parking which was a bonus. We decided to take full advantage of our room so didn't venture out into the surrounding area, however as we were there on a Sunday night everything seemed very quiet when we drove in. The ground floor reception area is nice, clean, modern and well decorated with a very polite reception staff who booked us in quickly and with no fuss. The ground floor has a nice bar/lounge area where they serve lovely cocktails, a great variety of wines and delicious (complimentary) snacks of nuts and olives. I have to admit that my one reservation about staying here was also the main reason for the stay - the height. The room was on the 42nd floor which gave it such beautiful and stunning views (from the large windows as well as the glass walled corridors) but also meant a long elevator ride, which for a claustrophobic was quite a daunting prospect. Thankfully, the elevators are large and airey and speed directly to the 40th floor (they don't stop before this as the first 39 floors are offices) so the experience was pretty painless! The rooms themselves are wonderful with large, comfortable beds and sparkling, well laid out bathrooms. We ordered room service and spent the evening eating incredible stone baked pizzas and drinking champage whilst admiring the view and it is an experience I would highly recommend. The complimentary binoculars were very much appreciated and came in handy for zooming in on Alcatraz and the Bridges. All in all, this a wonderful place to stay, it's extremely comfortable and whilst it may be a little more expensive than other places the views make it worth every single penny. I would definitley recommend the Bridge to Bridge room for a great night!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel! Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: craig_ng
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in October 2007. It is one of the best hotels available in terms of personal service. The location of this hotel is in the financial districts -- very close to most things. The entrance to the hotel is not exactly grand: it is after all not a huge property. But the rooms are lovely and spacious, mostly on high floors, with spectacular views towards the Golden Gate bridge and Alcatraz. The service is truly exceptional. The doorman recognises me and greets me by name each time I go through the front door, which is a nice touch. The gym is ... well, not so wonderful. It's small and tucked away in a room the size of a broom cupboard. But otherwise, delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “still the best in SF”
Reviews.Author: spiderback
Reviews.Content: The MO San Francisco still rates a mostly five star rating from me. I always return because the hotel is subtle, quiet, great service, great views and food. Pros: Everything a) check in flawless b)views amazing c)quiet..............most SF hotels are noisier. d) tasteful e}great food The only "con" is that the Mandarin Suite is next to the elevator. I have stayed in it now four times and I am lucky that the master bedroom is away from the elevator. Being noise prone, I am safely away from the elevator sound. The second bedroom is lovely but nearest to the elevator and with the proximity comes noise. Amongst all the others in SF, the MO is and has been for me always the best. Not to trash the others, in comparison to the Ritz (tired rooms with no views), the Four Seasons ( nice enough but with Hilton tendencies).........this is a lovely respite in SF. This is the best hotel in SF. The one bedroom suites are on higher floors with even better views.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jackpalance
Reviews.Content: "only four days" beautiful room with just incrededible service they even let us use the hotel car (lincoln) for short hops. just the best! if you can afford it . do it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a Place!!”
Reviews.Author: KHA1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!! What a great place!! Everyone sooo friendly and nice. We had kids with us and they were most welcome. Brilliant views (3rd tallest building in SF) we could see the Golden Gate bridge from the bath tub!! Great Food! Good Service and a wonderful place to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental was a perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kimal
Reviews.Content: The service we received at the Mandarin Oriental was outstanding! Absolutely every employee we spoke with was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was gorgeous overlooking the Bay Bridge. We were impressed with all of the details - from the slippers and bottled water left next to the bed, the lavendar satchets left on our pillows, and all of the wonderful amenities. We had breakfast in Silks, and the food and service were exceptional. This was our second visit to the Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco, and we would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection with an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: baburshah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the magnificient Oriental Suite for one night after being upgraded from their top deluxe guestroom. I had just checked out from the Ritz Carlton where my Louis Vuitton had been damaged after someone sneaked into my suite and tried to open the locked suitcase. The MO is superb despite a not so attractive location in the Financial District. Staff is great, nice without being snooty, service is excellent and the views are to die for. The in-room amenities are excellent and I wish I would have satyed longer to enjoy the space and views from my room. Look at the pictures and you will understand.

Reviews.Title: “MO compares favorably to Four Seasons & Ritz”
Reviews.Author: MindWideOpen
Reviews.Content: My two favorite hotels in SF are the MO and the Inn Above Tide in Sausalito. I've stayed in the Four Seasons and the Ritz and many other hotels in SF. Four Seasons may have better rooms in terms of architecture and the modern facility, but the location is not desirable (too many homeless wandered nearby and didn't feel safe at night). Nothing stands out at the Ritz; it has no view and its location is mediocre; services were good but the decor is a bit stuffy, old school like, typical of the Ritz chain. The view, services, and location at the MO makes it the best choice for me. I stayed at the Bridge to Bridge View room in July 2006 and the Golden Gate Bridge Mandarin King in August 2007. The main difference is that the Mandarin King has a bathroom with the tub by a large window with fantastic view. From the 48th floor, watching clouds rolling in below us and birds flying by the window, we felt like we were in an airplane. The sky bridge on every floor provides panoramic view of the entire city. Check out my photos for the amazing view. The services at the MO are always top notch. It's not the kind of hotel to nickel and dime its guests (unlike many other five star hotels). The business center offers computers with free internet access and printing (FS and the Ritz charge like $10 for 15 minutes). Also, I called up the room service to inquire about the name of the complementary wine we received upon arrival and was instead offered another complementary bottle. Housekeeping services were good and discreet. Its location is the best compared to the the FS and the Ritz. It's close to Embarcadero and the clock tower, next to a cable car line and the Bart station, within walking distance to Chinatown and the downtown shopping area. The food from the room services were quite good but the taxes, services charges, and gratuity accounted for a third of the bill. I didn't like the fact the the invoice include both 18% gratuity and services charges of $2.5/person, it seems like double charging but at least it's disclosed properly. Overall, the hotel is worth splurging for the best rooms and we plan to come back every summer.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel - it makes memories!”
Reviews.Author: ComputerMaverick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just experienced a couple of days at the Mandarin Oriental. The hotel is the best hotel that we have ever experienced - truly a 5 star. We were fortunate to have a room on the corner of the 45 floor and the views of the bay and city were spectacular. I cannot imagine any better views within the city. This was our first trip to explore San Francisco and we could not have been more pleased with our hotel experience. Room - outstanding from every perspective! The size of the room is huge - a spacious seating area with chairs and sofa, desk for business or internet use with an incredible view of the city all the way to Monster field. The hotel even provides binoculars to provide a close up view of all the city and the room has three large windows that almost provide panoramic views. The decor of the room is gold and black asian theme that is very tasteful and well done. The room is so spacious in ever way including the closet, built-ins for luggage, and a very large bathroom. The room has a large LG LCDTV that swivels for the entire viewing from any angle. A DVD player is also provided along with CD/radio for music and alarm. The window treatments were awesome in that there was a transparent screen and blinds with the Mandarin logo for allowing light in, but shielding the sun at the same time. The windows do open which was nice to allow some air into the room, but also allowed in some noise from the city below. Nice touch, but I would not think that many would open windows 45 floors up... The bed is elevated to allow you to enjoy the views out of the windows from the bed and the bedding is top notch. I normally do not sleep well in hotels when traveling, but this bed and bedding provided the best night's sleep ever - outstanding! The bathroom was quite large with separate large shower, tub, and plenty of space for everything. All of the accessories that you could imagine are provided down to the bathroom scales. Every detail was well planned and executed to the light switches for turning on/off lamps beside the bed. Everything was at your fingertips including a single remote control that controlled multiple electronic devices. We were delivered hot tea and cookies of our choice upon check-in. Turndown service provides house shoes, cloth on the floor for stepping into an out of bed, robes, window treatments closed, turndown, music, etc. the list goes on - dimmers on all lights, etc. Other minor details - the iron was the best ever at a hotel - high quality every place - marble and stainless in the bathroom, the soap and shampoo, etc. The elevator was extremely fast and the walk from the elevator across the bridge or connector provides the best views in the city - bay and city views - fabulous! I used the workout facility and it was very nice - TVs on the equipment with headphones provided - my only complaint for the workout facility was the treadmills did not provide any space to hold a bottle of water - you had to place on the floor which caused interruption in workout to stoop and get a bottle of water... They provided chilled water, apples, bananas, plenty of towels, very nice equipment with the exception of the treadmills as noted. The staff were very nice and would do everything to accommodate our requests. The concierge made Alcatraz reservations and made very good dinner recommendations outside of their hotel restaurant - Silks. We wanted to experience some of the other places for meals and did not dine at Silks within the hotel. Cons - valet parking is $50 per day - very pricey, but about the norm in San Fran. For the price of the daily room rate - it should include high speed internet - I think requiring additional $12.95 per day is ridiculous since every thing else is incredible. First impression - the lobby does not provide the overall first impression that you would expect from a 5 star hotel, but wait until you get off the elevator and move to a room before you judge the hotel. This hotel does not the have the marvelous lobby of the Fairmont per se, but the rooms are out of this world as compared to any other hotel in the city. I highly recommend the Mandarin Oriental for your next stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but ........”
Reviews.Author: bertie
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental was an interesting hotel. We sort of liked it, but didn't which seems rather vague I know! We stayed in a Bridge to Bridge room and our son was in a connecting Bay View Room. The rooms were great although a little small (long and narrow). The weather was not too good and we didn't really get the benefit of the fantastic views due to mist and fog, although this was nothing to do with the hotel! When we arrived we noticed that the lounge area was shrouded by black curtains as they were refurbishing the lounge. This was news to us and we hadn't been adivsed of this beforehand. We like to have a pre-dinner drink in a lounge so this was a disappointment to us as it was dim and gloomy. On two evenings we asked the front desk to book a restaurant for us. On both nights (although we were told verbally they had been booked) they hadn't which was rather disappointing and caused us a bit of hassle at the restaurants we thought we had booked. Finally, it was our wedding anniverary when we were there and this wasn't acknowledged either although our tour operator had told the hotel so. Pretty poor customer attention we thought. This may sound like doom and gloom but we are hoping that we were just unlucky, So don't be put off!! We like to give a balanced view, so there were good bits - good location, good bell boy and a brilliant view we are sure had the weather been on our side!!

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic visit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CitySlickerLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from another 4 days at the Mandarin. All I can say is WOW!! We opted for a different room this time, the Bay Bridge King as we found the Mandarin King a bit too pricey. Well the room certainly did not let us down. Once again it offered, a huge bedroom with wall to ceiling views of Coit Tower, Alcatraz and the Bay Bridge. The bed is unbelievably comfortable with plush down and comforter. The room is serviced twice daily and is absolutely immaculate. The bathroom towels are constantly replaced with fresh ones, morning and night. This hotel is marvelous, loosen the purse strings and enjoy its definatly worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: yellowstoner
Reviews.Content: This hotel made me soooo happy! We stayed there the last few days of more than a weeklong vacation and had already stayed in the Bellagio (Las Vegas) followed by two Best Westerns (California coast). Once our taxi pulled up to the Mandarin we didn’t have to lift a finger to do anything except hoist martinis and shop for a few days. I always consider it a good sign that while we pay the taxi driver, our luggage miraculously moves to the bell captain’s desk, and the front desk staff addresses us by name when we walk into the lobby. The service at the Mandarin was impeccable, the room was fabulous, the staff courteous and perfect. We had a bridge-to-bridge view room which allowed us to see the entire bay from the Bay Bridge to the Golden Gate. The only obstruction was the Transamerica Pyramid which was very close by. Our room was on a corner and had huge windows. You could lie in bed (watching the big flat-screen TV) and see the skyline. The one drawback to our type of room, high up with great views, was that no one wants to close their curtains. If you aren’t careful you can see other people in their rooms, and they can see you. This is just something to be aware of. I mean, the room comes with binoculars so it is no surprise that a bit of people watching occurs. The bathroom was quite nice. There was a volume control on the wall by the sink so you could hear the TV or CD player in the next room while in the bathroom. The speaker was under the sink. I have stayed in a lot of hotels, but I have never seen this feature before. The hotel had great towels, robes and slippers, and Caswell Massey toiletries. Like many nice hotels, the room included a complimentary umbrella to use while in town. These may seem like minor things, but they certainly cut down on the amount of stuff you have to pack. Overall, the room was pristine – it was like we were the first people to stay there. I always want a hotel to be so nice that I am tempted to stay in my room rather than go outside. This is definitely one of those hotels. I would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel chains in the World”
Reviews.Author: HI_Nokaoi
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at three Mandarin Oriental Hotels around the World. They are one of the best in the world when it comes to service. I have been to their hotels in Oahu, and Hong Kong and if you have the opportunity to stay at a Mandarin Oriental book it, you will not be disappointed. The quality of service, the attention to detail and the comfort of the rooms are fantastic. The appetizers and drinks at the lobby bar are great. I took my wife here in the fall of 2006 and as mentioned several times the views from the sky bridge is breath taking. The fall is my favorite time of year to visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “A great view is not everything...”
Reviews.Author: die_urlauber
Reviews.Content: First the best: The overview was very great, from golden gate bridge to bay bridge, alcatraz in front, very very beautiful... The rest is not that, I expected from a hotel that price. A fire alert in the middle of the night and no one from the hotel was interested to tell us, if we have to go out or stay at our room at the 46th floor - high enough to get panicky a little bit - about fourty minutes later a fire fighter arrived an told us - on request - they don't know any fire, they don't know, where the alert comes from and they don't know, what to do. The hotel stuff was not interested in helping them or any other guests. The next morning the stuff at the reception nearly couldn't remind, that anything happened the night before. The stuff couldn't remind, that we had a reservation with romantic package - containing some champagne and breakfast - very ignorant. And the housekeeping wasn't interested in filling up the amenities for the second night. I don't mind, so we could clean our ears just the one day. All in all, we do not recommend the hotel, exept for the view.

Reviews.Title: “I am a Huge fan!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBiztraveler
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel quite often on business, but also use it for occasional leisure stays. Service is absolutely top notch, and I find one of the reviews below which says you are treated as number in a computer curious at the very least and downright slanderous at worst. The staff goes out of their way to address you by name and provide as much or as little service as you wish. The criticisms of the bathrooms, however, are quite accurate. They were not refurbished in the recent remodeling and should have been. (One pet peeve is that the towels are not as luxurious as other luxury hotels I have stayed in, but that's sort of a minor issue.) The only other criticism I have is that while the TV's have all been updated and are plasma screens, the hotel has no movies on demand (yet, I am told). Other than the above, you will find finely appointed rooms, friendly and accomodating staff, and some of the best food in the city at Silks, the onsite restaurant. While some below criticize the size of the public areas, you should keep in mind this is a boutique hotel with no more than 110 rooms. That is a plus if you are looking for excellent service, as the small size allows the staff to attend to the guests. The lounge and bar are well-appointed and service is phenomenal. Other criticize the small workout room, but the fact is, it is seldom used and it is like having your own personal gym. Moreover, passes to Equinox Health Club & Spa across the street are available, as well as passes to numerous other health clubs throughout the city. I have stayed in almost every other major hotel in the city, including the Ritz Carlton, the Omni and the Mark Hopkins. When given a choice, I always choose the Mandarin Oriental. It is simply the best hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: Misha76
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me San Francisco for a romantic get away. From the moment we stepped into the hotel he had everything especially set up for us. Our incredible suite was perfect and he had the staff arrange pink rose pedals in a heart shape on top of the bed, so romantic. The view was amazing and the staff was wonderful. The bed was so soft and comfortable. Room service food is normally okay but here was fabulous. I love this hotel and will definitely come back. It is very pricey though so to have this experience you might want to keep that in mind but WORTH EVERY PENNY.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: oceankayaker7
Reviews.Content: We were here for a long weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday . Our greeting upon arrival was very warm and check in went without a hitch . My room requirements were done perfectly . Our dinner reservations at French Laundry and Gary Danko were arranged before hand by Jacque the concierge . Our bridge to bridge bay view room had a incredible view . The rooms had been nicely refurnished . I wouldn't be concerned with the bathrooms not being up to 5 star standards . They were more than adequate. Our bed was the most comfortatable bed we had ever slept in . This hotel is for those who want the best hotel views of the bay and for those who want the best service . Its in a very quiet part of the city which is perfect for our needs . The lobby needs a lot of work but I did find out that its being renovated soon . The service was perfect in every matter . My requests were easily handled . I should mention that this was our 3rd stay in a Mandarin Hotel in the last year, the other 2 being in New York City. The San Francisco Mandarin is far better in service and comfort than that of New York . We look forward to returning to this Madarin . They do a perfect job here .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Traveller016
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were fortunate enough to spend two days at this wonderful hotel on our return from our vacation. We were delighted to have been upgraded to a corner room on the 44th floor where the views were just stunning, it almost seemed a shame to leave the room. The service throughout our stay was efficient, friendly and unobstrussive. I would also like to recommend an Italian restaurant that we came across by chance - it is called Cafe Tirmamisv [-], the service was impreccable and my partner had the best steak he had ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Spot”
Reviews.Author: CaLove_travelling
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful. Awesome location. Nice food. Service is good. Room size is little small. I would recommend it for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars ... BUT”
Reviews.Author: Gruver
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a bayview queen in February 2007. People gripes and compliments regarding this hotel are both actually pretty accurate. This is essentially a boutique property, with a small lobby, lounge and restaurant on the first two floors of a high rise, with the rooms at the top of the tower. The public areas are small, and good looking enough, but for some reason feel very impersonal, and lack lounging space. The rooms, while not large, are not too small, but are beautifully decorated in a mixture of European and Asian furniture. The bedrooms are essentially like jewel boxes in the sky, and the views are breathtaking. The bathrooms, as other have noted, look a bit worse for the wear, but have a separate soaking tub and shower, which seems to be where the 5 stars try to break from the 4 star chain hotels. The baths, while spotless, apparently were not renovated with the rest of the rooms ... they have that "glamorous" 1980s look -- chunky beige and pink marble with gold fixtures. I suspect the baths have had little change since the hotel opened in 1987. The service, as one anticipates, was very, very good -- from the welcome tea service to the friendly and informative desk and door people. All in all, this is a 5 star hotel, but one that disappoints slightly. If you want a nice room with a great view, don't hesitate to book here. If you want the whole 5 star package, look at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: NVRam123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin for a special occassion and found the service to be absolutely top notch. The restaurant was wonderful (we planned a special dinner), the corner suite was spectacular, and the concierge was beyond helpful. My whole party-6 rooms-were all very impressed by the level of service that the Mandarin gave. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the standard of Mandarin New York”
Reviews.Author: Elysia
Reviews.Content: The arrival experience at the Mandarin SF is disappointing. The lobby and lobby lounge area are quite small, pokey and tired. Very similar oriental decor to the old Mandarin Hong Kong but without the scale of the space. The reception staff were, however, extremely welcoming and informative. The staff and service were generally one of the high points of the stay. The public areas really are a huge disappointment. The carpet designs are particularly jarring - lacking any finesse or subtlety. A pity that the design of the refurbishment did not emulate the contemporary design of the new Landmark Mandarin or The Mandarin New York. The good points about this hotel include the views and the room size. We had a corner suite facing away from the harbour. I'm sure the suites that face onto the harbour are quite amazing. Having windows on two sides of the room really gave the suite a feeling of spaciousness and lightness. The decor looks dated even though this room was recently refurbished. The bathroom is a disappointment - reasonable in scale but again shabby. On turning on the water the shower head fell off the wall causing water to flood into the room. This required us to change to another room and the staff were prompt and courteous in finding another room. One interesting and welcome feature was the ability to open the window to obtain fresh air - yes and on level 44 of the tower ! Scary. The room service was amongst the best we had ever had and reminded me of the superlative cuisine of the Mandarin Hong Kong (not the Mandarin Landmark). We had breakfast in the restaurant, Silks, on the lower level of the tower. Such a shame that it doesn't have the amazing views of the rooms. All these criticisms apart we did enjoy our stay and found the location quite central and convenient. We have found the Mandarin Oriental hotels to be of quite varying standards. The Mandarin New York is by far the best we have stayed at. The Landmark Mandarin Hong Kong has a superlative contemporary room design. The Mandarin London is one hotel I'd rather forget ! The Mandarin San Francisco is really a little ho-hum.

Reviews.Title: “Not a FAN”
Reviews.Author: Critical_But_Fair
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer commented, this hotel has no soul. It is stale. The lobby area (including what is alleged to be a bar) is lame, lame, lame. Except for the congenial service from staff and the great views from the upper level rooms, there is no reason to stay at this hotel. To be fair, I received excellent service from every employee. I was impressed. But, excellent service does not overcome a physical plant that requires major updating, from the public areas, to the small and inadequate workout room, to the bathrooms in the guest rooms. My room was nicely appointed and enjoyed a great view, but the bathroom was tired and dingy. For $450/night, this is not a good value. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with amazing views”
Reviews.Author: DRMEngland
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. We stayed on the 42nd floor with fantastic views of the bay. There was of course no traffic noise. The service was of a very high standard. The lobby was rather cold and lacking in atmosphere but that would not stop us staying at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very standard”
Reviews.Author: QTC
Reviews.Content: I'm used to stay at the European boutique hotels so I find that this one is as charming as a boiled potatoe. Yes, the views are great and the rooms huge but the furnishing was absolutely vulgar. It has no atmosphere, the guests are threated like numbers in the computer of the front desk! I'm not saying that this is a bad hotel, it is quite good actually, but don't expect to find the best hotel in the USA, simpli it is not

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: huhjinny
Reviews.Content: We had a Wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff was amazing. Very helpful and kind. This is the Best service we've had!!! Also the room was great- very clean, great view!! Highly Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Snidle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental October 17-21. My wife and I were taking encaustic art classes in the Bayview district and wanted a base to hit restaurants after classes. Decided to try the Mandarin to see if the reputation is warranted. We have been to San Francisco several times at the usual highly rated hotels. The Mandarin was such a delightful experience. We can't stop praising the attentive yet unobtrusive staff at this smaller hotel. We had a corner room on the 41st floor that overlooked the Golden Gate Bridge and you felt like you could touch the pyramid as you looked out past the tower onto Alcatraz. Our last night we experienced the famous fog as it rolled in and gently engulfed the city. We didn't want to leave the room. Used room service one afternoon to catch the Cardinals in the Series and they did a spectacular job. A slight wine error was promptly and graciously repaired to our benefit. The rooms are recently renovated and are lovely. Having the city as your nightlight is priceless. We shall gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: MattDrewry
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms are beautiful, the staff bend over backwards to help, the dining is divine. Nothing short of 5 stars all round. Why waste your time staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: hobe8000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin for the last two days of our wine country vacation before flying back to the east coast. The hotel staff was very eager and helpful. The room was fantastic, complete with Plasma TV and the most comfortable bed I have slept on in a hotel. Room was beautiful and so was the view. A memorable ending to a wonderful getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but not on par with the competition”
Reviews.Author: sanfranscott
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the weekend at the SF Mandarin Oriental. While the view and room were very nice the room service, food, and overall experience was not on par with other 5 star locations like the Ritz Carlton or St. Regis. If there were a rating for room service food I would have to give it a 1 star. I've had better food at low end hotels. The front desk staff was cordial but cold. We actually had to dig at them to get details on the package we purchased for our stay. If all you're looking for is view and quiet, this is your place. If however you want the total 5 star experience you're better off going to the Ritz Carlton in SF or Half Moon Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dudega1
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for a few days and must say that this is one of the better hotels in the country. I was in room 3905 which had a great view of the golden gate bridge in the background. Staff can't do enough for you, they always call you by name. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant Silks, but everything else in the hotel is top notch. They had a good rate of $395 a night for a room which normally sells for $610 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Sky High”
Reviews.Author: TeamS
Reviews.Content: My wife, 4 month old, and I just stayed at the Mandarin with the romance package for 2 nights. It was an excellent stay all around - we were on the 48th floor with views from the Golden Gate all the way past the Bay Bridge. Crib was provided with great amenities for new parents and it received its own turn-down service. The bathrooms windows over the tub made for great baths and overall the stay was just fantastic. Silks, the hotel restaurant, was very understanding in providing room service due to baby issues, and the staff were prompt, courteous, and always friendly. Highly recommended, this is our 2nd favorite hotel in the world (Peninsula Bangkok still rules).

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Sally6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights in July. We were upgraded to a Bay View Room that was fabulous! Asian decor - with amazing views. Upon entering the hotel all the staff were fabulous! Bell hop, valet, front desk, and concierge. Very pleasant, attentive and helpful in every way. We were made to feel so special with the staff always greeting us. We didn't want to leave! Great comfortable bed in the room- with top of the line amenities in the bathrooms. We loved the location- were able to walk to many of the best restaurants- Boulevard, Slanted Door etc. We ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning- and it was great! If you are looking for a 5 star hotel in San Francisco, with wonderful service and great accomodations - then this is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do great views make a great hotel?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for the first two nights of a summer holiday. This was our first stay at a Mandarin Oriental, and we had high hopes for the rooms, the service and the overall ambiance. The newly remodeled rooms are beautiful: the modern Asian feel of the furnishings combined with big picture windows with million dollar views made the cost of the room feel more worthwhile. The service was fine, but it didn’t have the warmth and thoroughness we expect from a five star property. Perhaps because of its location in the financial district, this hotel seems like more of a business hotel than a vacation home away from home. The public spaces aren’t really connected and this disjointed feeling doesn’t lend itself to spending time in the building. We also found it odd that the bar was never open in the evenings of our stay, despite the fact that we were at the hotel over a weekend when one might assume it would be open later. We were upgraded from our Deluxe City View Room to a Bay View Room with incredible views of the Golden Gate Bridge, North Beach, China Town and the Embarcadero. Although the smaller room was nice (we saw it before being upgraded to a room with the king bed we had reserved), the Bay View Room had more space and a much better view. We definitely appreciated the difference. Breakfast in the restaurant was wonderful and a definite highlight of our stay. We enjoyed our visit, but this is not a hotel we’d seek out again. Despite the nice rooms and wonderful views, the overall experience is more functional than fabulous. It’s very good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: la femme folle
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby and I stayed at the Mandarin and cannot say enough about it. We had the bridge to bridge view which was breath taking. You have the TransAmerica building directly in front of you, Coit Tower, Alcatraz, Bay Bridge, and Golden Gate view. They have binoculars in the room too. We had clear days and could see everything and at night the city was beautiful. The rooms are very large with a small sitting area, bathrooms are large with seperate marble tub and shower. They provided a lovely crib for our son and even put infant amenities in it, baby lotion, wipes, diaper, baby bath, ducky and small stuffed toy! They have a lovely jasmine tea service in your room when you arrive and also had a sweets/chocolates tray also. Valet/doorman were very welcoming and provided good suggestions for dinner etc. Complimentary bottled water in the room and fitness center is also a nice touch. They also had a notice that they are getting high def TV and satelite by July. Location was good, could walk to Embarcadero, ferry terminal markets, union square. Sundays are challenging though since many restaurants are closed in immediate area, but they have a free car service that will take you to dinner. Loved the Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: taguy
Reviews.Content: Superb service, spectacular views. If you care about service or views from the rooms, this is the perfect hotel in SF. 100.0% satisfied with every touch of service. We were upgraded to a king suite, on the top floor, and while expensive, was worth every penny as far as I am concerned. The room was really beautiful, with a spectactular view of the golden gate bridge, and the rest of the city. No pool, so don't bring the kids, but prompt and courteous service throughout, and plenty of amenities in the room. Bathrobes, slippers, free bottled water, and nice music was on when we returned to the room. Room service was prompt (a rarity I find these days), and valet parking always had my car ready. I'll stay here again on my next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best Service”
Reviews.Author: Shoreview
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 year old daughter and I just returned from 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental. I can't say enough about the service we received. Here are the highlights: * complimentary wine and tea in our room for us just after arrival * complimentary cheese, crackers and fruit waiting for us one evening after a long day sightseeing * concierge had a rental car ready and waiting for us within 30 minutes of our request * all staff called us by name every time they saw us * doormen learned what type of restaurants we liked and sent us to them in the house car There are lots of great things about this hotel: the view, quality of the rooms, the location but the people there make it a truly special place to stay. It beats the Trump, the Plaza or the Ritz hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: RichJNewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pricey, but, after several stays here during the past couple of years, this is my favorite hotel anywhere. If you have business in downtown S.F., and want to get in or out quickly to the airport, the location is perfect. The rooms are outstanding: comfortable beds, precise and subtle climate controls, magnificent views. The fitness center is good. The lobby staff is excellent. The atmosphere is one of quiet and privacy. The only downside is the food, which is merely edible. However, there is an outstanding steak house around the corner in the Omni, and numerous other good restaurants not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: ARS7
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying here last May. Started our California trip in San Francisco for 3 days followed by a drive down the entire coast. Also proposed to my wife in San Francisco on same trip. The hotel is lovely and rooms are of the highest quality. Beautiful rooms with only the nicest linens. Bathroom was also very nice and unique, the way a luxury hotel should be. The doormen went above and beyond for any of our needs and I give them credit for learning my name and remembering to call me by name every time I entered or exited. Something I don't ask for but certainly is nice to hear. The one concierge (male) was very nice and helpful, recommending and even making reservations at different restaurants that are unique to San Francisco. Although I did think that the female concierge could of been a bit more attentive when my wife's heel strap broke on our way out one night. There was no recommendation of shoe repair, though it was late and I doubt one would of been open. The best she came up with was pointing us to the mall down the street. Just nitpicking, but she didn't go above and beyond by any means. Overall a great hotel and upon departure my Hertz rental car was brought to the front door and bags placed in them by the wonderful doormen.

Reviews.Title: “The very best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used to call this "our" hotel because we loved it very much. We have tried to stay here at least half of the times whenever we came to The City when we still lived in the States. We even had our wedding here. The staff at Mandarin Oriental treated their guests as if they were very important people. Our wedding's ceremony and reception were held in Mandarin Oriental's Library Room. We stayed at the hotel but our guests and family members stayed in a different place downtown. Afterward, our children wanted to go back to their hotel so they asked the desk staff to order them a cab. "No, you don't need a cab; our limo will take you anywhere you want to go." The desk staff replied. At the time, our children were not very polished if you judged them from their appearance. They were the typical college students who lived in (and sometimes even slept in) their jeans, T-shirts, and track shoes. They were intelligent, polite, and articulate, but they were not preppy and definitely not the limo-rider kind. They were also not Mandarin Oriental's guests, but that fact did not matter to the staff. Everyone treated them with respect and courtesy. Every room in the hotel has panoramic view because of the floor-to-ceiling windows and because this all-glass hotel is the third highest building in The City. There are different views available with different room series. In every room, there is Frette linen, thick and soft bathrobes, his and her slippers, and high quality bath products. Evening service includes fresh fruit plate brought to room. Limo service is gratuity to guests (and in our case, family members of guests). Understated luxury and old world elegance are what you will find here. Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco writes the book about quality and service. I wish everyone else would read their book and follow their example. Note: Fridays and Saturdays’ rate is lower than during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Superb apart from the food”
Reviews.Author: HelenBygrave
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 5 star, central hotel to stay in San Francisco. Very friendly and helpful staff especialy the lovely receptionist who couldn't do enough to make my stay perfect. Views that take your breath away - romantic sunsets across the pacific ocean. Beautiful rooms that are manicured to perfection every day. The only downside was the room service food which was by far the poorest I have ever tasted. Salty, overcooked and lukewarm. I had the steak one night and then chicken linguine. The clam chowder was top quality however :) ps - I had a few friends staying at the OMNI round the corner where the steak was the best they'd ever had.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't wait to leave this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauna_kea_lady
Reviews.Content: although the views from our room were drop dead gorgeous, we were completely bored at the Mandarin Oriental and felt isolated in a sterile cube. the room furnishings lacked the austere beauty I'd been hoping for - the room's furnishings were quite plain and unremarkable. we were in a bridge to bridge view room - expensive - but we didn't feel pampered or special while staying at the hotel in any way. room service food was quite plain; good quality ingredients but not particularly delicious or gourmet. we actually felt a bit depressed in this hotel, we couldn't wait to leave - so we checked out a day early.

Reviews.Title: “lovely spot from which to see the city”
Reviews.Author: CBinNY
Reviews.Content: We splashed out on the Mandarin for the last two nights of our vacation, in part based on the reviews on this site. The view made the room worthwhile (although we were "only" on the 39th floor, and discovered that taking the elevator up to the top floor yields some spectacular views from the corridor). But we were assuming (in retrospect, for no particular reason) that the room would be larger, and that there would be a more appealing hotel bar to enhance our Mandarin experience. The service was impeccable - the concierge was more than happy to research and answer my random questions. This is an expensive hotel - if on company expenses, it would be a no brainer to stay here. But if you're on your own dime, it's definitely a serious splurge, so don't spend it if you're going to think about it too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: KeithTalent
Reviews.Content: Had a Bridge to Bridge room, with amazing views (but time the windows had a clean please!). Room very comfortable, quiet and relaxing. Rest of the hotel is a "miss", with no bar or restaurant you'd want to go to, and the decor is all a bit 1980s-style tacky and looking tired, but all is forgiven for the room and the views. Expensive though, especially outside of Fri/Sat nights, as this is a business hotel. Cost us $550+tax on a Sunday night, which was too much considering lack of a cool bar etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy, great view!”
Reviews.Author: AnonManc
Reviews.Content: Views are without a doubt one of the main attractions of this hotel. From room and corridors there is little of San Francisco that you can't see. Rooms are contemporary with an oriental flavour. Service discreet, attentive and polite. Turn down service excellent. Maid picked up of fault we were not aware of and speedily had it rectified by maintenance. Meal at Silk's one of the finest we experienced on our trip. Nice to try something out of the ordinary. Restaurent staff very knowledgeable and added to enjoyment. Only gripe is that two elevators did not seem to service the requirements of this hotel adequately. Certainly our hotel of choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “water infiltration in the bed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: unconfortable dirty plece to fly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Awesome Rooms and Spectacular views!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro66
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why would anyone bash this hotel. I've stayed at several Ritz Carlton's, Four Seasons, and other luxurious resorts. This hotel is top notch and probably is the best in SF. The service is absolutely amazing, anything you need, anytime. The Concierge is superb, I asked for a good sushi bar and he directed me to one of the best Sushi I have ever had. To boot the hotel sent us an appetizer on them. Having the hotel car available to take you to a play, restaurants in the ares is very convenient. The hotel views are one of the best (if not the best) of San Francisco. The Rooms are clean and ultra luxurious, the usual Mandarim Oriental high standards and touches. Beds are extremely confortable and the linens are 300 Thread count or better. All Marble bathrooms with every amenity in the book. It is going to be tough to go back to the Ritz (my favorite chain) in SF after I've stayed in the Mandarim. If you like to be pampered and enjoy the best, look no futher. Get a room with a view, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Fog can block your view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but don't bank on a good view all the time. We were in S.F. in August (Fog Season) and could not see the street from 38 floors up... not to mention ever seeing the bay. If you have an expectation of having a great view just cause you are on floor 38-48... just be ware. Otherwise, there are reasons this is regarded as one of the best in the world! Good look

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco is by far the absolute nicest hotel I have ever stayed. This is the second time I stayed there. The view was breathtaking and part of the reason we went back. I didn't think the view from the first time we stayed could be topped and yet it was!! The staff was absolutely lovely. It is definetely an upper crust hotel but I in my jean shorts, teeshirt and flip flops was never treated any different than the ladies and gentlemen in their formal wear. The staff is impeccable! I must admit I never ate at Silks (the hotel restaurant) but was assured by other guests that it was an unforgetable culinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel But Very Expensive for a Sightseeing Trip”
Reviews.Author: citygirl4616
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 days and 1 night in San Francisco (which is not nearly enough time to spend there) this June. The hotel is elegant and well maintained. The service was excellent (we are loyal Ritz Carlton guests when we travel) and we found the Mandarin staff to be very professional, well-trained, friendly, helpful, and unpretentious. We had a bridge-to-bridge room and the view in the hallway and in the room was spectacular. There were binoculars in the room, and what an awesome sight it was! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because as tourists, we spent very little time enjoying the hotel, yet payed almost $400 for the 1 night. We surely did not get our money's worth. I knew the hotel would be great, but had I realized that, other than sleeping, I would spend barely 2 hours in the room, I would have opted for a cheaper hotel, or at least a cheaper room. I would recommend a stay here if you will be able to enjoy the hotel and your room, not if you will be doing major sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “superlative service and room!”
Reviews.Author: emmab
Reviews.Content: THE most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! Also, huge tub in the bathroom and separate power shower, Frette bathrobes. Jasmin tea and cookies delivered to room upon arrival, chocolate strawberries and biscuits for our honeymoon. Lovely view of bridge. Very knowledgeable concierge. We did feel slightly untidy though walking through the lobby on Saturday evening, returning after a day's sightseeing as the ambiance is quite formal! Perhaps not the best location for sightseeing but handy for Chinatown and we like to walk anyway. We loved it here though and were given booklets about Carmel as we checked-out when we mentioned that we were driving down the coast. A nice touch! SF is a great city. All the tourist attractions are really worthwhile doing and the city has an energy simialr to NYC but not quite so frantic! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Rock Solid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service and unbelievable views made our stay at the Mandarin an absolute pleasure. Best in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Exxxxxcellence At The Mandarin San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel on Trip Advisor and decided to try it out. We were visiting SF on business and vacation ( for one week) with a 22 month old baby. Those times when we had to stay in the hotel because of the baby we did not mind, the view was excellent, the food from room service was divine. The staff was attentive and the concierge service was extremely helpful. We did not get to take advantage of the car service since it was unavailable on the two ocassions we requested it. The hotel was clean, even under the bed, where kids' toys tend to rest. The bathroom was spotless. The turndown service in the evenings was a treat. The pictures online are real and my room did look like one of those online. This hotel is quintessential feng shui glamour, understated, but very polished and it quietly exuded a monied atmosphere. There were even some top R&B stars and politicians who were also guests in the hotel. I am hard to please and I was quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: couf
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to China town and Union Square, a little further walk to Fisherman's wharf. Cable car stop just outside. Room was amazing. Beautiful views of the city. Bathroom was luxurious. Service was outstanding. The slightest request brought swift and curtious responses. Only thing was the dining room was closed when we arrived at 6pm for some reason, and valet parking added $50 a day to an already expensive bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, common areas need aesthetic updating...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a weekend in San Fran. We booked a room through the Mandarin's special packages...Golden Gate Bridge room (highest upgrade before you hit the suite rate,) free American daily breakfast, late 6pm checkout. The room was on the 46th floor, quiet, huge, nice hallway, incredible bathroom. Furnishings were interesting, a mix of Japanese with high tech. Turns out room number 4604 was an experimental model for the upcoming renovations. Mgmt chose not to go with that design, but for us it was rather perfect. We had a corner room, the views were stunning. The bed and bedding were superb. Sitting areas were very good, the bathtub was right next to a huge panoramic window. The tub itself could have been bigger, it was definitely too small for 2 (but we squeezed in anyway.) Amenities were by Escada, nice touch, perhaps a little too chemical for me (I prefer L'Occitane.) Tea service upon arrival. The common areas, however, look like they've been frozen in the 1980s. All that polished gold with green walls, weird carpeting, it's soooo dated. But who cares, we went to Fleur de Lys (fabulous) and Slanted Door for dinner. Btw, Slanted is overrated. Oh, and the gym at the hotel is EXCELLENT, but bring your own gear, because they don't have gym clothes for sale or rent. I worked out in my robe and slippers. Didn't get any stares because the gym was basically empty. Will we be back? Yes, at $459/night for that fabulous room with breakfast and late checkout, you bet!

Reviews.Title: “NOT the Four Seasons!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for four nights and five full days while at a conference in SF. As others have noted, there isn't a better view in town - lying in my bed (I was in a Bridge to Bridge Room) I could see just about every notable attraction in town - the bridges, Coit Tower, Alcatraz, etc., etc. etc. However, this is where the greatness in this hotel ends. Though I usually stay at the Four Seasons when I vacation, I decided that I ought to give the Mandarin a shot - hey, AAA Five Diamond, Mobile 5 Star - it can't be that bad.......let's find out: A stain on the bed sheet; pink gum on the top left door of the bathroom stall; foot prints on the carpet; mug stains on the marble around the sink and on a coffee table; a turn down service that was so insistent on getting the job done that they returned twice within an hour (the last time forcing themselves into the room as I dressed for the evening); a lobby and lounge staff about as personable as a paper weight; a doorman that was on his cell phone more often than he opened the door; and a concierge staff that said they would call me to follow up on an inquiry and forgot one too many times. These unmentionables were during the first two days - at which point I started complaining to my wife - telling her that we had made a mistake in the hotel we had chosen and that this hotel didn't hold a candle to the Four Seasons. I'm not one to publicly complain, but this deserved it, and my wife, without me knowing it, went down to the lobby, pulled a manager into the lounge, and in a very nice manner, without any of the aforementioned detail, summed it up for the manager by saying that the place sucked! The manager proceeded to offer my wife breakfast, a discount, etc. My wife refused everything, which she said surprised the manager. But, we weren't looking for handouts - we were looking for the level of service and attention to detail that we had expected when booking a hotel company that claims that it can and does deliver (and which I and many of you had read about and which I personally had heard about from some of my wife's colleagues who have stayed at their hotels in Asia). Well, over the next two days the level of service did a 180 - not just for us, but noticibly for everyone else as well! For us, the hotel town car, which hadn't been offered before - was now at our becking call; our names were used regularly upon entrance into and from the hotel; the front door was sprinted to as anyone approached; and we got reservations, on fairly short notice, to two of the city's hottest restaurants - Slanted Door and Betelnut. In summary, I guess I left wondering why this hadn't been the case from the moment we got there. If it had been, I wouldn't have written a few of the above paragraphs. This can be a phenomenal hotel with a few modern updates to the rooms, the fitness and business centers (sorry, fitness and business closets), and complete consistency in service. Maybe I was there on a bad week, but hopefully, we did everyone staying there from now on a favor - I doubt it though - excellence isn't sporadic and I am pondering on whether I should give them another fat chunk of my wallet at another one of their hotels/resorts. Can't beat it if you want a view, but don't pay these prices for a view - go to the Top of the Mark for a cocktail and stay at the Four Seasons where your wallet gets you treated like the well-paying customer you are. Good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. But I have to agree with one of hte reviews that the bathrooms are outdated as well as the elevator. Other than that, The views are hand down the best in San Francisco. The building itself is stunning and is the third tallest in the city. The price is to high for this hotel but if money is not a problem than i would say this hotel is well worth it. I stayed in the Golden Gate Signature room with the window in the bathroom and it was incredible at night soaking in the tub with a view of coit tower and the Golden Gate Bridge in the background. Overall, This is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Boris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandarin at the end of January 06. Very impressed with the service received from the staff, particularly concierge. They were so helpful and even sent the house car to come and get us one night from a restaurant as we had no energy left from walking up those hills! The hotel is clean and well kept. We had a Deluxe King Room with fantastic views of the city, bay area including Alcatraz and GG bridge. The bed was so comfy! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a safe, handy, flat location for exploring all SF has to offer. Would definitely go back as staying at another hotel would simply be out of the question! Enjoy! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot....excellent service & great location (but no pool/small gym)”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_C_NYC
Reviews.Content: The views are indeed spectacular within the rooms and I really liked my stay here, especially the location (right in the middel of downtown, easy walking distance to Nob Hill, Coit Tower, North Beach restaurants & bars). The hotel is on the upper floors of the building (I was on 43rd floor) and my room seemed very large for a non-suite (actually had a hallway); my friend's room wasn't quite as large but still roomy and big compared to most hotels I've stayed in. And although I'm not a very demanding traveler and don't need all the perks associated with some of the more decadent/full-service oriented types, the few times I needed help the excellent service came through. A fax I was expecting was ready for me within 5 minutes, and evey time I asked the concierge to check on my flight or make restaurant reservations it was done immediately. Allin all, the service was very polite and timely. The bathrooms in the room were large and contained everything you could possibly need - including a bath and separate shower. The bed was extremely comfortable - as was waking up to an almost 180 degree view of SF et environs every morning!! (I will have to bring my girlfriend here sometime). On the negative side, a few minor things. First, there are only 2 elevators which made for a couple minutes of waiting from time to time (usually not a problem). Also, the gym is very small and on the 4th floor with no windows which isn't ideal and not what I'm used to at other MO's (DC and NYC) which have much larger gyms with views and a pool (DC at least) - no pool here (unlike the Ritz and Four Seasons). And the hotel lobby is nice but pretty understated and small so don't expect a grand entrance - the location and views are what you pay for here. I will come back to this hotel, but as I'm a big exerciser I think that the Ritz and Four Season are also great choices if you want a larger gym and pool. (Have stayed at the Ritz but not the Four Seasons - Ritz is up near the top of Nob hill close to the Fairmont, Intercontinental, etc.)
